With your help Huber will receive his 15th loan through MFP, and he is committed to paying it back on time.  He is happy with his communal bank and enjoys being with the other members.  He plans to use the loan to buy five bags of organic fertilizer for his potato crop which will be harvested in July.

loans.use: To buy five bags of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Juan Benito

texts.es:
Don Juan, de 54 años de edad, originario de San Juan de Limay municipio de Estelí, de oficio comerciante, casado, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad ambos están estudiando. 
El se dedica a la compra, venta y almacenamiento de granos básicos como el maíz y frijol, lleva 15 años dedicándose a esta actividad ya que en su experiencia anterior fue como jefe de brigadas de enfermedades transmisibles por mosquitos pero vio quela comercialización de granos básicos se le ganaba mejor y se dedico a vender y almacenar maíz y frijoles.
El requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos. Ya que el crédito le brindara la oportunidad de poder adquirir granos básicos al por mayor y a buen precio para comercializar fue de Estelí e ir a comarcas fuera de su pueblo que necesitan abastecerse de este producto. Entre sus expectativas primordiales esta los estudios de sus hijos, cancelar su crédito, incorporar la venta de sorgo que un producto que se vender y poder comprar un vehículo para transportar su producto.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 54 years old and originally from San Juan de Limay in the town of Estelí. He is married and has two children, ages 18 and 15, who are both studying. Juan is a merchant who buys, sells, and stores dry goods such as corn and beans. He has been in business for 15 years. His previous job involved directing public health teams that prevented communicable diseases transmitted by mosquitoes. Juan discovered that he could make a better living by selling dry goods, so he decided to sell and store corn and beans.

He is requesting a loan to buy dry goods. The loan that will be granted to him will provide the opportunity to acquire products in bulk and at a good price. He will sell his products in Estelí and in the regions outside of the city that are in need of these items. His main expectations are to provide for his children’s education, repay his loan, add sorghum to his inventory of products to sell, and buy a vehicle for transporting his goods.

loans.use: to buy dry goods (corn and beans).

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es:
Edgar de 34 años, hace 12 años convive con su pareja, con quien tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 7 años. Esta familia habita en la calidez de un  hogar propio en el distrito de Palcamayo. Gracias a su habilidad y destreza, Edgar ha sabido desenvolverse con eficacia en las actividades que realiza. 
Desde niño aprendió a labrar la tierra junto a sus padres. En la actualidad cuenta con sembríos de papa, olluco y oca. Los que al cosechar vende satisfactoriamente en el mercado mayorista de Tarma. 
Así también posee 250 cabezas de ganado ovino, y algunas vacas. Con estos animales pudo iniciar su negocio de venta de carne de carnero. “Para cada feria sacrifico 2 carneros, vendo su carne, la cabeza, el pellejo, las patas y la menudencia”, comenta, agregando que la rentabilidad de su trabajo radica en la captación de clientes concurrentes. Para facilitar ambas actividades, Edgar cuenta con una camioneta, la que emplea para el traslado de sus cosechas, animales, y demás productos. Incrementar su producción de tubérculos es una de sus metas, y paralelamente abrir puestos de carne en el mercado de Tarma, para ello continua con su ardua labor. Éste sería su préstamo número 15 de MFP, como lo hizo en todo este tiempo, se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. “Mirando hacia un futuro mejor”, es el nombre de su banco comunal y a la vez uno de sus objetivos.
Invertirá el 50% del dinero en la compra de abonos orgánicos para su siembra de papas, y el otro 50% para la adquisición de carnes de carnero las que revenderá a mayor precio.
texts.en:
Edgar is 34 years old and has been with his spouse, with whom he has 2 children, ages 9 and 7, for 12 years.  This family lives in the warmth of their own home in the district of Palcamayo.  Thanks to his abilities and skill, Edgar has known how to carry out his activities with great efficacy.

As a child, he learned how to work the land at the side of his parents.  Currently, he has potato, olluco and oca (Peruvian tubers) crops.  At harvest time, his product sells very well at the wholesale market in Tarma.

He also has 250 heads of sheep and some cows.  With these animals, he was able to start a business selling meat.  “For each fair, I butcher 2 sheep and sell their meat, head, hide, and the hooves and giblets,” he comments, adding that his business’ profits hinge on capturing repeat customers.  To facilitate both activities, Edgar counts on a small truck that he uses to transfer his crops, animals and other products.

Increasing his tuber production is one of his goals, as well as opening meat sales stalls at the market in Tarma, which is why he continues to work arduously.  This would be his 15th loan with MFP and, as he has done all this time, he commits to being punctual with his loan payments.  “Looking Towards a Better Future” is the name of his cooperative bank and, concurrently, one of his goals.

He will invest 50% of the funds into buying organic fertilizer for his potato crops, and the other 50% to buy sheep meat to resell at a higher price.

loans.use: buy sacks of organic fertilizer and sheep meat.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma, de 42 años de edad, quien a duras penas logro terminar el primer grado de primaria, ha sabido salir adelante como madre, ama de casa y comerciante, ella es originaria de la trinidad municipio de Estelí. Sus comienzos fueron a los 22 años de edad cuando vendía ropa de manera ambulante este fue su primer negocio posteriormente estableció su pulpería donde vender productos alimenticio y de uso para el hogar. 
Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, aceite, azúcar, leche, cosméticos, productos para limpieza, ropa, zapatos. Pues el crédito le ayudara  a mantener surtido de productos que mas demandan sus clientes y le ayudan a mejorar sus ventas. Una de sus metas es lograr convertir su pulpería en una miscelánea de productos varios.
texts.en:
Vilma is 42 years old and barely finished the first grade. She knows how to succeed as a mother, a homemaker, and a merchant. Vilma is originally from Trinidad in the town of Estelí. She started out when she was 22 years old by selling clothes as a street merchant. This was her first business, but she later opened a store where she sells food products and household goods.

She is requesting a loan to buy basic grains, oil, sugar, milk, cosmetics, cleaning products, clothing, and shoes. This loan will help Vilma maintain her inventory of products that are most requested by her customers, thereby improving her sales. One of her goals is to convert her shop into a variety store that carries different products.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, oil, sugar, milk, cosmetics, cleaning products, clothing, and shoes.

loans.name: Americo Donato

texts.es:
Americo nació en la  ciudad de Cusco y vive en la ciudad del Ollantaytambo. Americo tiene 57 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo.

Americo es conductor de carros de turismo y también se dedica a brindar servicio de hospedaje. Ya son varios años dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su negocio. En esta oportunidad Americo requiere el préstamo para implementar su hospedaje y desea comprar toallas y sabanas.

Americo se encuentra agradecido por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Americo was born in the city of Cusco and now lives in the city of Ollantaytambo. He is 57 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has one child.

Americo drives tour vehicles and also provides hotel services. He has been in this business for many years and has done very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Americo is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can keep his hotel in operation and purchase towels and bed sheets.

He is grateful for the opportunity that has been provided and promises to complete his payments on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase towels and bed sheets and to pay for expenses to keep his hotel in operation.

loans.name: Donato

texts.en:
Donato has operated his two hectares of rice fields for almost 16 years. He is 41 years old, married to a midwife and has one child. Donato grows agricultural crops within the local community he lives. He is an industrious and responsible man. He mainly sows rice crops and then sells them on the market.

Donato said that working on the land requires effort and patience to be able to obtain a good production of crops. He and his wife work hard to earn a living. His wife is his partner in his farming activities. He really enjoys performing his farm activities because through this business, he could get a bigger income for his life. Donato would like to improve his crop production, but he has insufficient funds to buy inputs. With this regard, he is asking for a loan amounting to PHP 50,000. He is hoping that through his loan, he could improve his farming practices which will enable him to increase his yields, and thus he could provide for his family's needs and educate his only child.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his rice field

loans.name: Rene Raul

texts.es: Rene, originario de la  Esperanza comarca  localizada en Yalaguina municipio de Estelí , tiene 40 años de edad, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años de edad, el es comerciante dueño de una pulpería . El inicio su negocio atravez de un préstamo que le hicieron hacer tres años , fue comprando mercadería poco a poco y al mismo tiempo invirtió en elaboración de rosquillas en su comarca esta actividad la realiza por  la tardes anteriormente se dedicaba a la albañilería . El realizo el préstamo para comprar maíz, queso, arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, sopas, galletas, gelatinas, jugos, golosinas, detergentes.  Estos productos son de mucha demanda  a diario por lo cual el crédito le ayudaría a mantener inventario para solventar las necesidades de su clientela. El desea ampliar su pulpería con nuevos productos y vender sus rosquillas en los diferentes municipios de Esteli.
texts.en:
Rene is originally from Yalaguina in the town of Estelí, which is located in the region of La Esperanza. He is 40 years old and has a five-year-old son. Rene is a merchant and the owner of a store. He started his business with a loan he received three years ago. Rene purchased merchandise a little bit at a time. At the same time he invests in the production of donuts, an activity he performs in the afternoons. Rene previously worked as a bricklayer.

The loan he is receiving will be used to buy corn, cheese, rice, beans, oil, sugar, soups, cookies, gelatins, juices, candies, and detergents. These products are in great demand each day. This loan will help to maintain his inventory so that he can meet the needs of his customers. Rene wants to expand his store with new products and sell donuts in different towns around Estelí.

loans.use: to buy corn, cheese, rice, beans, oil, sugar, soups, cookies, gelatins, juices, candies, and detergents.

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is 45 years old and married with four children. She's from Calabayan, Ozamis City. 

Merlyn operates a livestock business raising pigs for sale. Merlyn has been 3 years in her business and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2007, Merlyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. This will be the third loan taken out by Merlyn from GDMPC.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Johnna

texts.en:
Johnna is married with 3 children. Johnna is 29 years old and lives in Bunawan, Calamba, Misamis Occidental.

Johnna sells ready-to-wear items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month she earns 4,200 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase assorted clothing items worth 10,000 PHP.

Johnna has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase assorted clothing items

loans.name: Cinthia Gladis

texts.es:
Cinthia vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

Cinthia, es una mujer casada de 26 años de edad,  tiene un hijo de menor edad el cual cursa el nivel inicial, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, eligio este tipo de trabajo por vocación ya que desde muy pequeña su madre lo venia realizando, y porque le sale muy rentable.
Cinthia es una  mujer empeñosa, responsable y muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de sacar adelante a  su familia, Cinthia tiene este negocio desde el año 2008, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/ 350 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 3000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo  invertirá  para la compra de mercadería ( leche, azúcar, sal, etc) para que su negocio pueda seguir creciendo y ofrecerles toda variedad de productos de buena calidad . El  sueño de la señora Cinthia es tener su propia casa y que su hijo llegue a ser un gran profesional para que así puedan tener una mejor calidad de vida, la señora Cinthia  esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando. su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Cinthia lives and works in Camaná, Peru, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú.  However, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. The  upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to set up their own microbusiness, like the one this client is running today.

Cinthia is a 26-year-old married woman.  She has one dependent child who is in elementary school.  Cinthia sells groceries.  This type of work was her vocation as her mother had been in the same business since she was a little girl and it is very profitable.

Cinthia is a determined, responsible and very hard-working woman who has a great desire to get her family ahead in life.  She has been in this business since 2008 and earns, on average, 350 soles a week.  She will invest this loan, which she will receive thanks to Kiva, in buying merchandise (milk, sugar, salt, etc.) so that her business can continue growing and so that she can offer her customers a variety of good-quality products.  Cinthia's dreams are to own her own home and for her son to become a great professional so that they can enjoy a better quality of life.  Cinthia is very grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.  Her loan officer believes her to be a good client and believes that she will make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (milk, noodles, sugar, etc.)

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is married with four children. Elizabeth is 55 years old and lives in Mabini Street, Molave.

Elizabeth sells electronics to earn a living and has had this business for four years. Each month she earns 20,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase electronic materials for her electrical supply business.

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to invest in a business that will give satisfaction to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase electronic materials for her electrical supply business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 56 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. She is married and has four children.
 
To earn a living, Lydia has a business selling bananas. She earns about PHP 3,600 each month doing this type of work. Lydia has requested a loan to purchase ten sacks of feed for her piglets.

Lydia has been a member of PMPC for four years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of feed for her piglets.

location.town: Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Leni

texts.en:
Leni is married and has four children. She is 45 years old and lives in the Philippines.

She is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan to purchase additional pigs to raise.
 
Leni has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs to raise.

loans.name: Urania Maria

texts.es: Urania, de 30 años de edad, habita en la ciudad de Leon, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, ella se dedica a atender una pulpería en su casa de habitación. Inicio este negocio con ayuda de su abuelita quien se dedicaba a la venta de mercadería en general fue ella quien le dio la idea de que vendiera gaseosa para que tuviera su propio negocio y no dependiera de su esposo. De hecho ahora es su esposo quien le ayuda con la venta poco a poco fue comprando mercadería para su pulpería lleva 4 años con este negocio. Pero dice que le hace falta llenarla de mas productos variados , es por ello que realizo el préstamo para comprar granos básicos, productos de limpieza, productos lácteos , ropa, juguetes, cosméticos ya que quiere tener una pulpería bien surtida e invertir en poner una pequeña tienda de ropa y juguetes para diversificar su negocio.
texts.en: 30-year-old Urania lives in the city of León.  She has a 5-year-old son.  Urania's business is running a grocery store in her home.  She started this business with the help of her grandmother who used to sell general merchandise.  She was the one who gave her the idea of selling sodas in order to have her own business and not have to be dependent on her husband.  In fact, now it is her husband who helps her with her sales.  Urania has gradually bought merchandise for her store and now she has been in the business for four years.  However, she says that she needs to fill her store with a greater variety of products.  For this reason, she is taking out a loan to buy basic grains, cleaning products, dairy products, clothes, toys and cosmetics as she would like to have a well-stocked store and invest in setting up a small clothes and toy store so that she can diversify her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cleaning products, dairy products, clothes, toys and cosmetics

loans.name: Rochelle

texts.en:
Rochelle is 30 years old, single, and is from Pulot, Ozamis City.
 
To make a living, Rochelle has started a business venture, selling fresh egg products in the local community. She has been in this business for one year and earns 8,000 PHP per month. 

In 2007, Rochelle joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rochelle is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase a transport vehicle to be used for delivery. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a transport vehicle to be used for delivery.

loans.name: Saul

texts.es:
Saul, es un hombre soltero de  21 años de edad,  el  se dedica al servicio de transportes, eligio este trabajo porque le gusta tratar con la gente y porque le sale muy rentable este negocio.
Saul vive y trabaja en Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the Southwestern part of the country. Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance. Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.
Saul es un hombre responsable, empeñoso y muy trabajador con muchas ganas de salir adelante, Saul empezó en el negocio desde el año 2010, gana semanalmente  un promedio de S/ 250 nuevos soles. Con el préstamo de S/. 2000 soles que recibirá gracias a KIVA, lo invertirá para el mejoramiento de su vivienda ( construcción de cuartos). El  sueño del joven Saul es tener su propia empresa de transportes a nivel nacional y que llegue  a ser muy reconocida, el señor Saul esta muy agradecido por la oportunidad que se le esta brindando. su asesor cree que es un buen cliente y que si cumplirá en pagar puntualmente sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Saul is a young, single man of 21 years and offers a transport service.  He chose this job because he likes to work with people and because it is a profitable business for him.  

Saul lives and works in Camaná, Perú, an oasis in the otherwise long, dry Sechura Desert that dominates the coastline in the South-western part of the country.  Camaná was historically a major tourist destination in Perú, however, frequent and forceful earthquakes and tsunamis in the last decade (an 8.4 in 2001 and 8.0 in 2007) decimated the city, permanently destroyed Camaná’s tourism industry, and lost many their jobs, livelihoods, and homes. But the one upshot of unemployment is that it creates an environment primed for microfinance.  Microfinance allows a jobless entrepreneur to realize their would-be microenterprises, like the one your client is pursuing today.

Saul is a responsible, hard working man with a strong desire to get ahead.  Saul started out in 2010 and earns an average of S/ 250 new soles.  With the S/. 2000 soles loan that he will receive thanks to KIVA, he will invest in improvements to his home (building an extension).  Sauls' dream is to have his own national transport company that will one day become well renowned.  Saul is very grateful for the opportunity give to him.  His advisor believes him to be a good client who will make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to make improvements to his home (to build an extension)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy necessary building materials and to pay for construction labors to build a fence.

loans.name: Daajinsuren

texts.en:
Daajinsuren is a single mother who lives with her two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia.  Her elder daughter is a college student and the younger one is a school student. 

She started her garment retailing business in 2008 by renting a counter in the market. Her garments are very fashionable and cheap. Now that her business is stable enough, she rented another counter in the same market. However, she lacks resources to run a whole counter. 

Daajinsuren is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "It's been hard since my husband died. However, my elder daughter made it to college this year. Therefore I can't give up." 

She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is married with five children. Emelita is 38 years old and lives in Malintuboan, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte.
To earn a living, Emelita has a general store. She has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns approximately 60000. She has requested a loan of 35000 to purchase stocks for her general store to sell. Emelita has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Emelita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store to sell

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en: Terbish is 51 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Govi-altai province, Mongolia. His wife helps with his business and his two daughters are college students. He started his business in 1995 by selling garments by renting a counter in the market. Now he also runs a business trading raw materials like metal, copper, etc.  However, his raw material trading business needs 1,500,000 to purchase more iron. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says "Now that my daughters are in college, I need to do everything in order to support them."

loans.use: To purchase more iron.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 71 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is widowed with 7 children. 
Loreta has a shop that sells products such as toothpaste, soap, canned goods and biscuits. She has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 50000 to purchase additional products such as toothpaste, soap, canned goods and biscuits.
Loreta has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Loreta hopes to save money in case of a future emergency.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as toothpaste, soap, canned goods and biscuits.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en: Mrs. Neak is 42 years old. She is a widow, living with 2 single children in Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh city. Mrs. Neak earns a living by selling used and new clothes in mobile places. Through her business, she is able to earn an income of $5.00 per day. Since she divorced her husband, she has tried very hard to raise her two children. Presently her stock has run out, so she decided to look for some funds from Kiva’s lenders to purchase a stock of clothes for a constant sale. For the future plan, she hopes to have her own store for selling her clothes.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of clothes for a sale.

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 50 years old, lives with one child and is from Santo Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lita owns and operates a business venture, making and selling banana-cue food in the local community. Lita has operated this business for over three years and she earns 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Lita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and gain the ability to engage in business activities. Lita is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase ingredients needed in making banana-cue. This will be the third loan taken out by Lita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed in making banana-cue (barbecued banana)

location.town: Santo Nino, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: El señor Ignacio, es un humilde campesino, de 48 años de edad, quien se dedica a vender leña y a criar cerdos, el vive en Chacaraseca una comarca de León,  tiene 4 hijos que ya son independientes. Don Ignacio a duras penas aprendió a leer y escribir pero con trabajo honrado se ha sabido ganar la vida en su humilde carretón de caballo donde monte la leña para salir a vender en toda la comarcas pues donde vive no todos tienen acceso a cocinas de gas la mayoría son muy pobre y cocinan con leña cuando no se dedica a esta actividad el se dedica la crianza de cerdos para vender. El requiere el préstamo para comprar un lote de leña y comprar cerdos para crianza. El espero seguir comprando poco a poco materiales de construcción para ir componiendo su casa poco a poco, mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ignacio is a humble 48-year-old rural worker who lives in Chacaraseca, a region of León.  His business is selling firewood and raising pigs.  He has four children who are independent.  Ignacio barely learned to read and write but, through honest work, he has known how to make a living from his humble horse-drawn cart on which he carries firewood to sell in different regions.  Where Ignacio lives, not everybody has access to gas stoves.  Most people are very poor and they cook with firewood.  When he is not working in this business, Ignacio raises pigs to sell.  He needs this loan to buy a load of firewood and also some pigs to raise.  He hopes to continue gradually buying building materials so that he can gradually build his house and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a load of firewood and also some pigs to raise

loans.name: Enshai

texts.en: Enshai is a 52-year-old widowed mother of four who lives in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) with her children in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. Two of her sons work in the construction trade. Her other two sons help their mom with her business. She started her business retailing dairy products in 2000. Since her husband died, her family's income has been decreasing. Therefore, she needs a cow to increase her income. In the future she plans to open her own store in which to sell dairy products and to have her own cows. She is requesting 1,000,000 MNT to buy milk, yogurt  and koumiss (a fermented dairy product) at wholesale prices. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "This loans helps me to carry our family living."

loans.use: To buy milk, yogurt  and koumiss at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is married and has six children. Virginia is sixty three years old and presently lives in Calolot, Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental.

Virginia works as a food vendor in her barangay (village) to earn a living and has had her business for many years. Each month she earns more than 1,000 PHP in her business. She requested a loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

Virginia has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for two years. In the future, Virginia hopes that she can earn more than she needs in her business through the help of PMPC.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Oyungerel is 44 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Govi-Altai province of Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver, her elder son is employed, and her younger son is a college student. She started her business journey in 2000 by selling meats, however she started selling groceries, which is more profitable, in 2010. She already bought a pick-up truck with the profits from her business. Now that her business is profitable, she rented another counter in the market to run the same business. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "Now that my kids are grown, it is time to concentrate on my business." She is requesting 2,500,000 MNT to buy more grocery products at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Lorita

texts.en:
Lorita is 63 years old and lives in Lopoc, Labason, Zamboanga Del Norte. She is married and has eight children.

Lorita works in the fish industry and catches and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more fish to sell.

Lorita has been a member of PMPC for more than a year. In the future, Lorita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

loans.name: Enhsaihan

texts.en: Enhsaihan is a single mother and lives with her mother and son in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her son is a student and her mother is a retired old woman. She started her business in 2009 by renting a café in two star hotel. Her café has tasty meals and good service. Her facility needs some repairing and she is lacking in the supplies needed to run her business. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says, "I am the only one with an income in the family. If i can't do the necessary repair, I will lose my business." She is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to repair her cafe.

loans.use: to repair her cafe.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy some household supplies, kitchen supplies and other necessary materials for use in the family.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria, from the village of Panduma Sr. Tukuran, ZDS, is a 58-year-old married mother of one child. Gloria owns and operates a sari-sari (general store) that sells a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 24 years, she earns approximately 15,200 PHP a month.

In 2008, Gloria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is now requesting her seventh loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. Gloria plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

location.town: Panduma Sr. Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en: Gloria, a 20-year-old married mother of two, lives in Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte, where she has been selling fish for a living for two years. A member of PMPC for two years, she has requested a loan of PHP3000 to purchase more fish to sell. In the future, Gloria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell.

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Nursapar

texts.en: Nursapar is 40 years old and lives with his wife and six children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia. His wife cares for their children. The eldest child is a college student, the middle three are students in school, and rest stay at home. He started his business repairing and selling salvaged cars and in 2003. He also runs a taxi service using his own car. His engineering skills are incredible and he is the only one with an income in the family. Now that winter is approaching, he needs to maintain his own car to run his taxi service properly. He is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 58 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Gloria has a general store business. She earns about 3,700 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Gloria has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase more stock of products to sell.

Gloria has been a member of PMPC for 10 years.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of products to sell.

loans.name: Terbish

texts.en:
Terbish is a 70-year-old woman who lives with her husband in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her kids are all independent and employed. 

Terbish started her garment retailing business in 2008 when she retired from teaching. Her business is going well and it is very supportive for her living. Now that winter is approaching, she needs support to buy winter supplies. She is a strong and hardworking woman who says "First I was little scared to start a business considering my age and all, however now that I started it isn't scary at all. In fact, it makes me feel young again." 

She is requesting 2,000,000 Mongolia Tughriks (MNT) to purchase clothes for winter.

loans.use: To purchase clothes for winter.

loans.name: Lennie

texts.en:
Lennie works hard to support her family. Lennie is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.

Lennie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for sewing like fabrics, needles, thread, and a sewing kit.

Lennie has been in this business for 11 years now, and she also earns additional income from selling ready-to wear clothing.

In the future, Lennie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for sewing like fabrics, needles, thread, and a sewing kit

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.en: Fe is 40 years old and lives in Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga. She is married with one child. Fe works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for nine years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase ten boxes of fish to sell. Fe has been a member of PMPC for four years. Fe is the leader of a three person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase ten boxes of fish

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a soft drink retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy more cases of soft drinks to sell.

Leonila has been in this business for five years. Leonila earns more income from selling firewood and ready-to-wear clothing.

Leonila has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more cases of soft drinks

loans.name: Munhertunts

texts.en: Munhertunts is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayanhongor Province in western Mongolia. Her husband is a herder, her elder child is a school student, and other one goes to kindergarden. She started her dairy product retailing business in 2009 by renting a counter in a market. Before that, she used to sell her dairy products directly to the wholesalers. Now that she sells her products herself, it is much more profitable, however her produced dairy products are not enough to run a whole counter. She is requesting 1,200,000 to rent a cellarage to stock her dairy products.

loans.use: To rent a cellarage

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a small room made of bricks under her wooden house

loans.name: Charlito

texts.en:
Mr. Charlito is a businessman making furniture in Digson, Bonifacio. He is 50 years old. He is married to Charles and they have two angels that make their family complete.

He gets his source of living from his business and his wife's business. He was able to maintain his business successfully; it is manageable despite the problems that come. He joined Paglaum MPC this year, 2011, because he is very interested in the program and services that PMPC offered, and because it is the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao.

For his first loan cycle, he was given the privilege to avail himself of the amount of 30,000 PHP to add to his capital for his existing business. The future income from his business will be used for his basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future of his family.

loans.use: to add additional capital for his business

loans.name: Jose Irnel

texts.en:
Jose Irnel is 41 years old and lives in Poblacion, Molave. He is married with three children.

Jose Irnel has a boarding house business to rent and earns approximately 18,000 PHP each month doing this type of business. He has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase materials for his boarding house renting business.

Jose Irnel has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Jose Irnel hopes to earn more in his new boarding house.

loans.use: to purchase materials for his boarding house renting business

loans.name: Dugarmaa

texts.en:
Dugarmaa is a single mother of three who lives in a rented house in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Her two daughters are school students and the other one goes to kindergarden.

She started her hairdressing business in 2004 by taking hairdressing training. Her hairdressing business has been stable for many years. However, now her competitors are increasing. There are many nice and cheap places available now, therefore she is losing a lot of customers.

She decided to buy make-up equipment to make an additional service. She is requesting 400,000 MNT to buy make-up for hair and some equipment from Ulaanbaatar.

loans.use: to buy make-up

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.en:
Maria Lourdes is married with three children. Maria Lourdes is 45 years old and lives in San Isidro, Mahayag.

Maria Lourdes sells in a sari-sari (local convenience store) to earn a living and has had this business for twenty years. Each month she earns15,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase more stock for her general store.

Maria Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Maria Lourdes hopes to earn each day to prepare for her monthly payment.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store business

loans.name: Urjinsuren

texts.en:
Urjinsuren is 48 years old and lives with her husband in a ger (a Mongolian yurt or tent) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a sick old man who stays at home.

She started her business journey in 2003 by renting a counter in a market to sell groceries.  Now she has built a small shop in her own yard. She extended her shop this year. However, due to the building cost, her resources are not enough to fill the extended part of the shop.

She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy supplies. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says,"I have to do everything to cover my husband's medical costs."

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin aims for better yields and higher profits for every crop. He is 49 years old, widowed, and has been blessed with three grown up children. He acts as both a father and mother to his children. In this situation, Edwin's goal is to push him to continue to improve his farming practices to earn a living. Though he experiences hardships and difficulties in maintaining his rice fields, still he gives his best. 

One of Edwin's technique in improving his rice production, is by completing the necessary farm inputs for his rice field. "Planting rice crops is not that easy," said Edwin, "because it needs hard labor, dedication, and most of all financial matters."

Edwin would like to borrow PHP 40,000 to buy farm supplies for his rice farming business. He hopes that he can obtain a plentiful harvest and greater profits to improve his living condition and save some for his emergency purposes.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for his rice farming business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is 40 years old and married with 2 adult children. Rosalina is from Capucao, Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Rosalina operates a charcoal-making business. She's been in this business for 15 years and she earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. 

Rosalina is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase charcoal equipment. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Rosalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal equipment

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Mrs. Elizabeth owns a business buying and selling bananas.  It has been in operation for two years. She is a business woman in Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is at the age of 28 years old, married to Angelito and they have 3 angels as their children.  She gets her source of living from her business of buying and selling.

She was able to maintain her business through her efforts, even in hard times, and this time she is earning an average net income of not less than 10,000 PHP a month, which she said is so helpful for herself and for her family.

She joined Paglaum MPC in the year 2011 because she is very much interested in our products and services as one of the most outstanding cooperatives in Northern Mindanao, having been awarded Most Outstanding Cooperative in the Philippines during the search for COOP-LGU Partnership Award 2006.

For her first loan cycle she was given the privilege to avail herself of the amount of 50,000 PHP to add to her capital for her existing business of buying and selling bananas. The future income from this business will be used for her daily basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future. She is hoping that someday she will be able to expand her little stall and also see her business progress.

loans.use: to add additional capital to her business

location.town: Sta. Cruz, Tangub, City, Misamis Occidental, Minda

loans.name: Nui

texts.en:
Nui is 40 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. She has two children who are going to school.

She makes rice cakes to sell.  She has had this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND). The last time she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the third time she borrowed money from SEDA. In this loan she would like to borrow 9,630,000 VND to buy rice to make rice cakes.

loans.use: to buy rice to make rice cakes

loans.name: Gerarda

texts.en:
Gerarda is 46 years old and lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. She is single.

Gerarda is a farmer and grows pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 9,000 PHP to buy feed and medicines for her pig business.

Gerarda has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Gerarda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines for pig-growing business

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is a business man who buys/sells copra (dried coconut meat) and bananas.  He lives in Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City. He is married to Maribel, age 23,  and they had one blessing that came in their life and that is his child. 

Jerry gets his source of living in his buy and sell copra/banana. He has been able to maintain his business successfully from a young age. As his 1st cycle of loan neared completion, Jerry was allowed to borrow PHP 50,000.00 to add his capital for his existing business.  The future income from his business will be used for his basic needs, loan repayments and savings for the future of his family.

loans.use: have additional capital for buying/selling copra and bananas.

location.town: Isidro D. Tan, Tangub City, Mindanao

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.en:
Ainagul is 44-years-old and lives with her husband and two kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Bayan-ulgii province, Mongolia. Her husband is a construction worker. Their elder son helps with her business and the younger one is a college student. 

She started her business in 1998 by selling meat. Now she runs a grocery shop which is more profitable. She has many customers therefore, she extended her shop space. Due to extension cost she hasn't got enough money to run her business. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I am the one with the income in family. Therefore, I need to do everything I can in order to support my family." She is requesting MNT 3,800,000 to buy products from Tashkeshken.

loans.use: to buy products from Tashkeshken.

loans.name: Richell

texts.en:
Richell is 32-years-old, married with one child and she's from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

Richell is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Richell has been 3 years engaged in her business and she earn 5,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Richell joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Richell is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional product to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Richell from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional product to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electronic supplies for the process of repairing.

loans.name: Bayanmunh

texts.en:
Bayanmunh is 44-years-old and lives with her husband and six kids in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Uvs province, Mongolia. Her eldest 6 children are school students, another child goes to kindergarden and another one stays at home. 

She is planning to start a shoe-making business. She already has all the required equipment and she made two pairs of shoes which are quite stylish and comfortable. She is a sharp and hardworking women who says,"I used to run a grocery shop but it is not enough to support our children. Therefore I decided to make shoes which I am good at and it is more profitable." She is requesting MNT 1,600,000 to buy materials.

loans.use: to buy materials.

loans.name: Joselina

texts.en:
Joselina is 43 years old and married with four children. She's from Pan-taon, Ozamiz City. 

Joselina operates a livestock business, raising pigs for sale. She has been in this business for five years, and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Joselina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joselina is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock to raise and sell. This will be Joselina's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Precy

texts.en:
Due to unemployment, Precy decided to invest her small capital of PHP 3,000 in buying processed meat products to resell. She was able to enter into college, but unfortunately she got married while studying so her parents did not send her anymore. She is now happily married to Amado and blessed with three children. To earn an income, she buys and sells meat products such as longganisa, tocino (cured and pork sausages), fish balls and other dim-sums to sell in their village. 

She wants to diversify her business but due to insufficient funds, she choose to get a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy more longganisa, tocino, and fish balls to sell. 

Precy aims to own a stall in the market where she could sell her products conveniently.

With her patience and determination, she hopes that someday she will provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy more longganisa, tocino, and fish balls to sell.

loans.name: Mansueta Group

texts.en:
Mansueta is married with 12 children. Mansueta is 56 years old and lives in Montol, Ozamiz City.

Mansueta is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 14,999 PHP to purchase abaca products for her business. Mansueta has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Mansueta hopes to be successful in her chosen business.

Mansueta is the leader of a two-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: to purchase abaca products for her business.

loans.name: Batsaihan

texts.en:
Batsaihan is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in his own apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. His wife helps with his business. His oldest child is in school, and his youngest child stays at home with her mother. 

Batsaihan started his transportation business in 2005 using his own car. He has two cars, one of which his wife drives. His car is getting old, and it causes a lot of difficulties for his business. He has already found a buyer for the old car and found a good deal for a new car. He is lacking 2,500,000 MNT to buy new car. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "My wife drives one of my cars. It is difficult for a woman to drive an old car that always has problems."

loans.use: To buy new car

loans.name: Doan

texts.en:
Doan is 45 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city. She has three married children. Mrs. Doan sells pork in the market. She has done this job for ten years. She has a monthly income of about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND). 

The last time Mrs. Doan took out a loan, she borrowed 7,840,000 VND and repaid this loan punctually. This is the fifth time she will borrow money from SEDA. This time she wants to borrow 9,632,000 VND to buy more pork to sell.

loans.use: to buy more pork to sell.

loans.name: Anhzaya

texts.en:
Anhzaya is 23 years old and lives with her parents in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her father is disabled and her mother is unemployed. 

Anhzaya started her beauty salon business in 2007 by completing her training that same year. She has one employee. She has many customers; however, she is starting to lose customers due to powerful competitors. She needs to act aggressively in order to run her business succesfully. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I am the only one in the family with an income, and if I lose my business I won't be able to forgive myself."

She is requesting 2,000,000 MNT to buy equipment for her salon.

loans.use: to buy equipment.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 27 years old and married with three adult children. Eliza is from Sinusa, Ozamis City. 

Elisa owns a plot of land, where she plants and harvests a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been engaged in this work for over 10 years, and she earns 3,000 PHP every month.

In 2011, Elisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elisa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise. This will be Elisa's first loan from GDMPC. Elisa wants to financially support members of her immediate family and to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young plants to raise.

loans.name: Dolgorjav

texts.en:
Dolgorjav is 37 years old and lives with her husband and two kids in her own apartment in the Selenge province of Mongolia. Her husband is a security guard at the local bank and her two children are students. 

Dolgorjav started her hairdressing business in 1993. She is very experienced and a talented, bright woman. Her business is stable and well known by the locals. Now that her business is stable enough, Dolgorjav wants to increase her family income by buying a car so her husband can run a taxi service. 

She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My husband's income is relatively low, and I want to increase it in order to raise our children properly." She is requesting 3,500,000 MNT to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy a car.

loans.name: Vickie

texts.en: Vickie is married with no children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. Vickie is a farmer and she raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 3 years. She requested a loan to purchase additional feed for the pigs. Vickie has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen is 28 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village in the Yen Phong district of Bac Ninh. She was married and has three children who are still young. To earn a living, she not only grows rice but also makes tofu to sell. She has been doing this for 5 years. She has a monthly income of about VND 6,000,000. Duyen has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed VND 7,392,000 and repaid it punctually. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow VND 9,632,000 to buy beans for making tofu.

loans.use: to buy beans for making tofu to sell

loans.name: Ryskan

texts.ru: Рыскан 53 года, замужем и имеет двух взрослых детей . В 1996 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Рыскан начала заниматься торговлей хозяйственными товарами на местном рынке. Высокий спрос на хороший ассортимент товара Рыскан,  сделавшей основным направлением своей торговли электротовары, позволяет получать прибыль в сумме около 40,000 сом в месяц. Доходы от бизнес-деятельности позволили Рыскан приобрести торговый павильон на рынке. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы от кредита Рыскан планирует направить на расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Ryskan is 53 years old and married with two adult children. In 1996, in search of a source of income for her family, Ryskan began to sell household goods at the local market. There is high demand for a good variety of products. Ryskan made electronics her main products and is able to make a profit of around 40,000 som a month. The income from her business activities enabled Ryskan to purchase a shopping pavilion in the market. To further grow her business, Ryskan has approached Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan of 70,000 som to expand the range of her products. With the income from the loan Ryskan plans to expand her retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of goods

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a small room made of bricks with a metal gate.

loans.name: Princevelle

texts.en: Princevelle is 20 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married with 1 infant child. Princevelle has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles, etc. She has been operating this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to buy more products for resale. Princevelle has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for two years. In the future she hopes to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase more canned goods, noodles, shampoo, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Habsamet

texts.en: Habsamet is 51 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in a ger (traditional Mongolian hut) in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is employed and his son is a college student. He started his taxi service business in 2008 with his own car. He is a well experienced driver. Now that his car is old, he is unable to run his business. He is requesting a loan of MNT 1,800,000 to buy new parts for his car. He is a sharp and hardworking man who says, "It has been horrible since my car got broken apart. I have to fix my car in order to pay my son's college tuition."

loans.use: To buy new parts for his car

loans.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en: Gerelmaa is 47 years old and lives with her husband and son in a ger (traditional Mongolian hut) in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a cab driver and her son is a college student. She started her flour and rice selling business in 2000. Now that her son joined a college, she bought another stall to run the business. However, her supply is not large enough to run the business and therefore she is requesting loan of MNT 2,500,000 to buy more flour and rice at whole sale prices. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "My son is the first one to go to the college in my entire family. I will do everything I can to support him."

loans.use: To buy more flour and rice at whole sale prices

loans.name: Maricris

texts.en: Ms. Maricris is a private employee of Philam Life Insurance in Ozamis City. She is 24 years old and lives in Barangay II, Tangub City. She joined Kiva's partner, PMPC, because she is very interested in the program and services offered by PMPC and for the reason that PMPC can give her financial assistance towards her masteral degree. And she heard that PMPC is the most outstanding cooperative in Northern Mindanao. As her first loan cycle, she was given a loan of PHP 20,000 to finance her studies.

loans.use: to provide financial assistance for her masteral degree

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is 34 years old. She lives in Trung Ban village, Yen Phong district, Bac Ninh city. She has three children who are going to school. She has a store. She sells groceries and she is a cobbler. She has had this job for 10 years. She has a monthly income of about 6.000.000 Vietnamdong (VND). She always needs loans to expand her business. So she has participated in SEDA since 2007. The last time she borrowed 7.840.000 VND to invest in her store. This is the sixth time she has borrowed a loan from SEDA. This time she would like to borrow 9.632.000 VND to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products, and other things for her store.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products, and other things for her store.

loans.name: Adelyn

texts.en:
Adelyn is a 40-year-old married woman with 9 children. Adelyn is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. 

Adelyn is operating a specialized retail store, selling a variety of food products in the local community. Adelyn has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and she earns 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Adelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adelyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores is 48 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamiz City. She is widowed with 5 children.

Dolores has a dried fish business and earns approximately PHP 10,000 a month doing this type of business. She has a requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional stock of her general business.

Dolores has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Dolores hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase stock of her general business.

loans.name: Tem

texts.en:
Mrs. Tem, 32, is a married woman and a diligent farmer who has been living in Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham province. She is really busy at her farming business during the rainy season. However, she also take some free time to operate a fast food selling business from a booth as shown in the picture. She sells fried meatballs and bread with a sauce in order to earn more income. She has two children who are attending school now. 

She is requesting this loan to pay for rented farmlands, which she has rented from her neighbors. For the future, she intends to buy extra farmland and grows more rice crops as much as she can.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmlands.

loans.name: Consorcia

texts.en: Consorcia is 62 years old and lives in Poblacion, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has nine children and earns a living by selling a variety of dried fish and vegetables. She has been in this business for three years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,500 to buy more items to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for the last two years and hopes to earn enough money to send all of her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 43 years old and lives in Helen Village, Larena, Siquijor. She is married, has three children and earns a living by selling a variety of foods. She earns about PHP 10,000 a month and is applying for a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more ingredients and spices. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for seven months and her goals are to send all of her children to school and grow her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients and spices for food a vending business

loans.name: Chut

texts.en:
Chut, a 55-year-old mother of two married children, lives in Cho town where she has had a shop that sells movie tapes, dvds, and cds for the past five years. She earns a monthly income of about 5.500.000 Vietamdong (VND).

A participant in SEDA since 2007, Chut always repays her loans punctually. Having last borrowed and repaid 8.736.000 VND, she is now requesting her sixth loan for 9.632.000 VND to buy more dvds and cds to sell and appliances for her house.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and CDs to sell and appliances for her house.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is 45 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married, has three children and earns a living by running a store where she sells toiletries. She has been in this line of work for five years and is applying for a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy more products to sell to her customers. She has been a member of PMPC for four years and hopes to earn enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more toiletries to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Ly is 60 years old and lives in the town of Cho with her three children, all of whom are married. She earns a living running a shop where she sells videotapes, DVDs and CDs. She has been in this line of work for five years and earns about 5,500,000 Vietamdong (VND) a month. She joined SEDA in 2007 and has taken out five previous loans which she repaid fully and on time. She is applying for a new loan, for 9,632,000 VND, to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy videotapes and videodiscs to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Antonia Group

texts.en: Antonia is 61 years old and lives in Tinago, Ozamis City, Misamis Occdiental. She is married, has four grown children and earns a living by selling canned goods, soap, toothpaste, noodles and other items to her customers. She has been in this line of work for four years and is applying for a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy more items to sell. She joined PMPC last year as a way to expand her business. She also leads a two-person loan group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has her own business

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lily Tabanas 's Group

texts.en: Lily is a 58-year-old widow with five children. She lives in the Philippines and earns a living by growing corn. She has been in this line of work for 10 years and is applying for a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy fertilizer for her farm. She has been a member of PMPC for many years and hopes to set aside enough money to deal with future emergencies. She leads a two-person loan group.  Although the members borrow as a group, each has her own business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farm.

location.town: Sangay Daku, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Zarina Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
Zarina ramzan is a 36 year-old female. She is married and has 3 children who are 10, 7 and 2 years old. To make a living, Zarina performs the duty of a health worker in her community. She gives health awareness to ladies and solves their health problems.   
Her husband owns & operates a business venture in the food sector operating a butcher shop. He sells chicken meat specifically to his clients. His fresh quality meat and good in weight helps attracting more clientage to his shop. Although, he hasn’t enough experience in his business but his dedication and hard working skills enable him to make good place among his clients and market. 

Zarina is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah which will be used to invest in expanding her husband’s business by purchasing chickens in bulk. 

Zarina is hopeful that the increased numbers of chickens will help her husband completing the orders on time and generates more revenue.

Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Zarina ramzan”.

loans.use: To buy chickens for chicken meat selling business

loans.name: Saadabu

texts.ru: Саадабу 48 лет, вдова. Воспитывает  3 дочерей и 2 сыновей, младший из которых школьник. На протяжении уже 20 лет Саадабу занимается  животноводством и перепродажей скота, начав этот бизнес с суммы 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве  Саадабу имеется 2 коровы, 10 овец и 10 коз, а также кормовая база в 50 снопов клевера, 80 снопов кукурузы и 150 кг. кукурузы. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса,  Саадабу обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку молодняка – телят и овец. Доходы от  кредита Саадабу планирует направить на покупку участка под строительство еще одного сарая для скота.
texts.en: Saadabu is 48 years old, she is is a widow. She is raising three daughters and two sons, the youngest one goes to school. During the last twenty years Saadabu has been doing animal husbandry and reselling cattle by starting the business with an amount of 25,000 KGS. Thanks to her persistence and hard work right now Saadabu has two cows, ten sheep and ten goats as well as a fodder supply in 50 bundles of clover, 80 sheaves of corn and 150 kg of corn. Saadabu has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 100,000 KGS with the purpose of further growing her business and to buy young calves and sheep. Saadabu plans to use the profit from the loan to buy part of the land to build another shed for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Vinh

texts.en: Vinh is 49 years old and lives in Cho Town with her husband and two children, both of whom are married. Her husband and her children all work, and she contributes to the family income by running a store. She has been in this line of work for five years and earns about 6,000,000 Vietnamdong (VND) a month. She is applying for her sixth loan, for 9,632,000 VND, to buy foodstuffs, drinks, dairy products and other items to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Mrs. Ben is a 31-year-od married woman with four children who lives in the Pouk district of Siem Reap province. She earns a living by selling fish thA. her husband catches along the Tonle Sap River. Her income depends mainly on the size of her husband's catch, and many of his nets are currently torn and broken. She is applying for this loan from HKL and Kiva to buy new fishing equipment for her husband. She will also use some of the money to repair her house, which has many leaks. This loan will allow her family to earn more income and live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy new fishing equipment for her husband and repair her house.

loans.name: Mairamhon's Group

texts.en:
Mairamhon is the treasurer of this three-person loan group. She is 44 and married to a driver, who works in Russia. She has two sons and a daughter. Her sons work in Russia and her daughter studies at school while she works as a midwife in a local hospital. She has saved some money from her salary to buy a washing machine, but needs this loan to complete the purchase. This machine will mean a big improvement in her living conditions. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about our organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine.

loans.name: Ruzihon's Group

texts.en:
Ruzihon leads this three-person loan group. She is 55, a widow and has raised two sons, one of whom works as a builder while the other is employed in Russia. Ten years ago, with an initial investment of 2,800 soms, Ruzihon went into business as a farmer. This year she grew two tons of wheat and sold part of it to pay for her daily expenses. She is applying for this loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, with profits from her next the harvest, she plans to repair the roof of her house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru: Абдурашит житель района Кубодиён. Возраст, 46 лет. Женат. Имеет троих детей. Его жена занимается торговлей. Сам он тоже занимается торговлей. У него имеется магазин, который он арендует. Абдурашит занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров. В этой области он три года. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара с целью привлечения новых клиентов.
texts.en: Abdurashit is a resident of the Quabadiyon district.  He is 46 years old, married and has three children.  His wife is involved in sales and so is Abdurashit.  He leases a store, where he sells household goods.  He has been in this business for three years.  He is requesting this loan to expand merchandise selection in order to attract new customers.

loans.use: to expand merchandise selection in order to attract new customers

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a widow with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past three years she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future.

With the 10,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, oil, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking fat, oil, and rice.

loans.name: Ashirbu's Group

texts.en:
Ashirbu leads this four-person loan group. She is 55, lives with her husband, and works with him at raising livestock. They started this activity a long time ago and are highly experienced. When they need money, they sell some of their animals. She is applying for this loan to buy more animals to raise. In the near future, they plan to celebrate their younger son’s wedding. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy more livestock.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia, 36 years, kind and responsible woman.  She is married and has five children who are 8, 7, 5, 4 and 2 years old. She is happy with her children and husband by her side. She shares her house with them where she and her husband strive daily very much to attain a better quality of life. 
Safia’s work consists in sewing. Her work is home based.  She is well experienced in her business. She is uneducated but she doesn’t want to befall the same destiny to her children that’s why she sews clothes and afford the education expenses of her children.  
Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He offers his services to the passengers by dropping them to the destinations. He charges fare area wise. He has been in this profession for over 10 years.  
By using his rickshaw for past 10 years, he has found his rickshaw’s body is damaging which creates a bad effect on his passengers.  
Therefore, Safia is requesting for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for this purpose. Her husband will use the loan in buying a new body of his rickshaw to make his rickshaw a new look and save his business asset. 
She is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to his business.

loans.use: To buy a new body of rickshaw

loans.name: Sitambi

texts.ru: Ситамби жительница города Куляб. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет троих детей. Она занимается шитьем. В этой области она десять лет. Кредит берет для приобретения усовершенствованной швейной машинки.
texts.en: Sitambi is a resident of the Kulob city.  She is 53 years old, married and has three children.  Sitambi is involved in sewing and has been in this business for ten years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a modern sewing machine.

loans.use: to purchase a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Hamidahon's Group

texts.en:
Hamidahon leads this three-person loan group. She is 21, married to a builder and raising an infant. Two years ago, after her marriage, her family gave her a cow and she began breeding farm animals. She sells one whenever she needs money, and is applying for this loan to enlarge her herd by buying two sheep. Her goal for the future is to earn enough money to buy a car.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously).
