MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to buy two sheep.

loans.name: Baktykan

texts.ru: Бактыкан  - 38 лет, вместе с мужем  воспитывает троих детей. В поисках источника финансирования, в 2002 году  Бактыкан начала свой бизнес в перепродаже фруктов и овощей на местном базаре.  Стартовав с суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS), Бактыкан приложила все усилия для развития торговли и на сегодняшний день получает прибыль в сумме 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц.  Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыкан обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на расширение ассортимента товаров.  Доходы она планирует вложить в  расширение торгового места.
texts.en: Baktykan is 38 years old, and, together with her husband, she is raising three children.  In search of financial help, Baktykan started her own business of reselling fruits and vegetables at the local market in 2002.  Having started with an initial sum of 5,000 som (KGS), she put all of her efforts toward developing the sales and earns a monthly profit of 15,000 som (KGS) today.  In order to further grow her business, Baktykan requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to expand her product selection.  She plans to invest the earnings into expanding her retail space.

loans.use: to broaden an assortment of products

loans.name: Savronbi

texts.ru: Савронби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 43 года. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Савронби занимается торговлей на рынке. У нее смешанный ассортимент товара. В этой области она восемь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения канцелярских товаров.
texts.en: Savronbi lives in the city of Kulob.  She is 43 years old, married and has four children.  Savronbi is involved in sales at a market.  She has a mixed assortment of goods.  Savronbi has been in this field for eight years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of office supplies.

loans.use: to purchase office supplies

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is applying for a loan for Kshs 60,000 to expand her shop by buying bundles of wheat flour, sugar, rice and maize flour to sell to her customers. In the future, she dreams of expanding her shop and opening a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and rice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is a married woman who is 39 years old. She lives in Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Merla owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month she earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional stock of goods to sell. Merla has been a member of GDMPC for two years. In the future, Merla wants to build a house and to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of goods to sell

location.town: Campo 5, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Naga Tegal Wangi Group

texts.en:
The Naga Tegal Wangi group are to receive their first loan from Kiva partner MUK. The name of the group is inspired by the dragon fruit, which are plentiful in this village (Naga means Dragon, Tegal means Garden and Wangi means Smell Good). The members hope that the group will be strong like a dragon and successful, so “smell good” and inspire other people.
Ni Made, 30, is head of the group. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. Her husband works as a chilli farmer on his own land. To support the household, Ni Made helps her husband in the garden and runs a pig business from her home. She already has two sows and they are both pregnant. This loan will be used to buy feed for the sows and the piglets that will be born soon. Ni Made has a plan to be a piglet seller. She hopes that with the support of MUK, the business will continue to grow and that she will be able to help her husband support their children's education for a better future.

loans.use: to buy feed for her sow and piglets.

loans.name: Debora

texts.en: Deborah is a widow with three children, two of whom are old enough to attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped-in water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the past 11 years, she has earned a living by selling food to her neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the seasonal nature of her business. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 100,000 to open a handcart business by buying 10 handcarts and bundles of sugar, maize flour and cooking fat. She joined Yehu as a way to expand her business.

loans.use: to establish a hand cart business by buying 10 handcarts and bundles of ingredients.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 30 years old and still single. She live with her parents at Caritan Norte, Tuguegarao, City. Ana Marie finished her vocational school. She involved herself in direct selling of beauty products such as cosmetics, perfumes and make up. She sells AVON, SARA LEE and NATASHA products. 

She is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy more quantity of cosmetics, perfumes, and make up to sell in the village where she lives.

In the future, Ana Marie would like to keep generating good income from her business and continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy more quantity of cosmetics, perfumes and make up to sell

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунира по специальности портниха. Она занимается шитьем у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности она занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки разноцветных и однотонных тканей, чтобы сшить платья для торговли.
texts.en: Munira's profession is a seamstress.  She is involved in sewing at home and has been in this business for 20 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of colorful and single-tone fabrics in order to sew dresses for sale.

loans.use: to purchase colorful and single-tone fabrics

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en: Khadija is married and has three children, one of whom is still in school while the other two have graduated. She owns a house that has electricity and piped-in water and her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. For the last five years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal to her neighbors and passersby. Her main challenge is the seasonal nature of this business, which is why she wants to begin selling coconuts as well as charcoal. She is applying for a loan for Kshs 50,000 to buy 60 sacks of coconuts to sell. She joined Yehu as a way to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is taking another Kiva loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to boost her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. Amina dreams of expanding and establishing another business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is 61 years old. She's a widow with two children, and she's from Ozamis City. 

To make a living, Natividad operates a charcoal making business. Natividad has been 10 years in this business and she earns 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month. 

In 2011, Natividad joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Natividad is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase charcoal equipment. This will be Natividad's second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal equipment

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is 34 years old and has been married six years now. Ronald and his wife decided to engage themselves into rice farming after marriage. They plant and harvest rice for future merchandise to traders in their village. They usually earn about P20,000 during harvest season (usually falls during the month of April and November). 

He is now asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy fertilizers and insecticides use in farming. He hopes to increase his crop production to yield for a higher income. 

In the future, he would like to save enough money for the college education of his only child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for use in farming

loans.name: Gayatri Indah Group

texts.en:
This group was formed under the supervision of the village leader. The group consists of ten women who have similar pig breeding businesses. They established a group to receive a loan and training from Kiva partner, MUK.
Ni Komang is head of the group. She has three children, all of whom are still in school. She works as a cook in the school canteen. To support the needs of her children, she also runs a pig business from her home. She has a plan to use the loan to purchase two piglets and feed, and to renovate the pig pen. She hope that her pigs will grow fast and that her business will increase her family's income.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and feed, and to renovate the pen.

loans.name: Tojihol

texts.ru: Тожихол проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 57 лет. Разведена, имеет пятерых детей. Работает на рынке. У нее имеется собственная торговая точка, где она продает мужскую и женскую одежду. В этой области Тожихол уже 20 лет. Она берет кредит для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Tojihol lives in the Shahrituz district.  She is 57 years old, divorced and has five children.  She works at a market.  Tojihol has her own retail outlet, where she sells men's and women's clothing.  She has been in this business for 20 years.  Tojihol is requesting this loan to increase goods turnover.

loans.use: to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 27-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 2 and 8 years; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling breads in Kator, South Sudan, for one year.

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Thung

texts.en: Mrs. Thung, 44, is a resident from Pouk District, Siem Reap Province. She is a widow and a mother of three single children. One of her children is working as a laborer in a nearby country, Thailand. Her son always got along with her and sends a part of his salary home every month. The other two are students who live under her income. Mrs. Thung has operated a pig-raising business for 11 years. She is an experienced pig raiser. This year, Mrs. Thung wants to enlarge her wooden piggery and to purchase more piglets to raise. She hopes that this project will earn her a good income. Now she is seeking a loan from Kiva partner, HKL to achieve her project. For the future, she wishes to expand this business and to have a medium sized pig farm.

loans.use: to enlarge her wooden piggery and to purchase more piglets to raise

loans.name: Nasira's Group

texts.en:
Nasira lives with her husband and 5 children in a small house. Three of her children are studying while other 2 are very young and haven’t started their education yet. 
She is a housewife and performs her household tasks by staying at home. Due to her supportive nature, her family has good respect for her. 
Her husband is very hardworking person and prepares snacks of great taste that sells for good price among his clients. Nasira provides full support in preparing snacks for him to sell. He then put those snacks (called Papad in local language) on his bicycle and sells by visiting different streets of the city. 
Nasira has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her husband’s business. With the loan investment, he will buy ingredients such as spices, gram flour and cooking oil in larger quantity to be able to prepare better quality snacks that will help him increasing his sales and profits. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasira.”

loans.use: To buy gram flour, spices, cooking oil for snacks making & selling business

loans.name: Maghanoy's Group

texts.en:
Cresencia is married with 4 adult-aged children. Cresencia is 60 years old and lives in Guba, Clarin, Ozamiz City.

Cresencia sells assorted goods to her general store to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for general store to purchase daily commodities like foods (canned goods, biscuits, etc.).

Cresencia has been a member of PMPC for one year. Cresencia hopes to expand her business in years to come. Cresencia is the leader of a 3-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase daily commodities like foods (canned goods, biscuits, etc.).

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lorena is 36 years old and has 3 children who are in school.

Lorena has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Lorena requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sewing materials like needles, threads, seam rippers, etc.

Lorena has been in this business for 5 years. Lorena would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like needles, thread, seam rippers, etc.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children.
 
Aida has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna proves to be a responsible wife. She helps her husband do some activities in the farm. They owns a hectare plot of land on which they have been cultivating rice for four years now. They plant and harvest rice for future selling to traders in their village. They usually earn about 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) and use it well for the education of their three children.

Lorna is now requesting a loan to improve her crop production. She needs 10,000 PHP to buy rice seeds and fertilizers for use in farming. Through their patience and sacrifices, she hopes this loan will help increase her output and save for the education of her children.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for use in farming.

loans.name: Rassel

texts.en:
Rassel is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rassel is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.

Rassel has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Rassel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fabric and sewing materials.

Rassel has been in this business for five years. In the future, Rassel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fabric and sewing materials.

loans.name: Hermail

texts.en:
Hermail is 31 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children.

Hermail provides motorcycle or habal-habal transport services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy tools and pay for the utilities for his business.

Hermail has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Hermail hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy tools and pay for the utilities for the business.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business of selling bags in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more bags to sell to customers.

Teresita has been in this business for five years. Teresita earns more income from buying and selling of clothing.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell to customers.

loans.name: Sawe Rahayu Indah Group

texts.en: To continue her business, Ni Komang is requesting a new loan to buy four more piglets. She already has a good pig pen from her last loan. Ni Komang earned a good profit from her last loan and she has been able to save some money. Her business helps her to support her children's education and other needs. Ni Komang wants her children to have a higher education for a better future.

loans.use: to buy four piglets.

loans.name: Sotera

texts.en:
Sotera is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Sotera has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Sotera has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Sotera hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a 30-year-old a married woman with three children between the ages of 3 and 11, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling maize grains in Kator, South Sudan, for five years.

Eva requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase maize. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase maize grains for sale.

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en: Sorm, a 42-year-old married woman, a responsible mother of five single children, has two businesses: she is a hog-raiser and a fresh fish seller. She has had these businesses since 2000. Her husband is a local rice cultivator and takes some time to catch fish for her along the Tonle Sap River. Together, they typically earn an average of $5.50 per day. Mrs. Sorm wants to use this loan from HKL to purchase a buffalo that could be used to work on her farmland. Her future goal is to expand her pig-raising business and to provide her children a good standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo that could be used to work on her farmland.

loans.name: Zacaria

texts.en:
Zacaria is 59 years old and lives in P6 Bangkal, Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is married with 4 adult-aged children. 

Zacaria has a shop that sells dried fish and longanisa. She had this business for one year. She requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase dried fish and to purchase the primary ingredients in making sausage.

Zacaria has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, Zacaria hopes to expand her business and to become a supplier of Longanisa within the city.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish and sausage.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 62 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Vicenta has an internet café business in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional computer unit and computer supplies.

Vicenta has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Vicenta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional computer unit and computer supplies.

loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children.

Elenita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Elenita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Elenita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 46 years old and lives in Danao, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 

Grace works in the fish industry and sells and catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to purchase fishing accessories like hooks and pay for gasoline and maintenance for her fishing boat. 

Grace has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Grace hopes to save more for the education of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fishing accessories like hooks and pay for gasoline and maintenance for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Junar

texts.en:
Junar is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with five children. 

Junar has a junk shop in which he buys and sells recycled materials like plastic, metallic, and paper products. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy recycled products like plastic bottles and metallic materials.

Junar has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Junar hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy recycled products like plastic bottles and metallic materials.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 56 years old and lives in Burgos, Oroquieta City. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Rosita has a sari-sari store. She earns about 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. Rosita has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase stocks for her general store.

Rosita has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.  In the future, Rosita would like to have merchandise to earn enough money to meet her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase stocks for her general store.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.en: Marcelino is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with two children. Marcelino has a rice field that harvests and sells rice grains during harvest time. He has had this business for 10 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for the rice fields. Marcelino has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Marcelino hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the rice fields

loans.name: Jenilou

texts.en:
Jenilou is male and a farmer living in Dalaoig, Alcala, Cagayan. He married his wife Lenie last April 2011. They have no children yet. His wife is also involved in rice farming. Together they plant and harvest rice for future merchandise. This serves as their primary source of income.

Jenilou is now asking for an additional capital in improving his rice field. He is now asking for 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy five bags of UREA, a fertilizer used in farming. He hopes to improve his crop production.

In the future, Jenilou would like to save enough income for the improvement of his business and to his family's lives as well.

loans.use: To buy five bags of UREA, a fertilizer used in farming.

loans.name: Celerina

texts.en:
Celerina is 54 years old and married with five children. 

Celerina is in the agriculture business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Celerina requested a loan for 11000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Celerina has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Celerina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 30 years old has three children between the ages of 11 and 18 years old. Two of her children are in school. She is a widow. She has had a business selling breads in Kator, South Sudan for one year.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase breads. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Ivy

texts.en:
Ivy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Ivy has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Ivy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Ivy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 29 years old and married with two children. With one child in school, Liza works very hard to provide for her family.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan for 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her store.

Liza has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her store

loans.name: Safia Bibi's Group

texts.en:
Safia bibi is a 36-year-old woman. She is married and lives with her family: her husband, 9- and 5-year-old sons, and a daughter who is 7 years old. All of her children go to school to get an education.

Safia works as a seamstress at her home. Along with her main job, she is actively involves in her household works. Her husband operates a pesticide selling business. He mainly sells his products to the farmers, who buy pesticides from him for their lands. He has been running his business for many years.

Safia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will use the loan in buying pesticides in bulk quantity to be able to fulfill the larger orders of his customers and increase his profits. Safia is hopeful that the loan investment will bring positive financial changes to her husband's business and her family will use the increased income for their well being.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for resale.

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
Genalyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.

Genalyn has a motorcycle with a cart from which she sells snacks like coconut juice, banana cue (deep-fried banana covered with caramelized brown sugar), and gulaman juice. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Genalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Jocyrell

texts.en:
Jocyrell is 22 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Jocyrell has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Jocyrell has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocyrell hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely is 20 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Lovely runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. Lovely has been running the general store for two years and she also earns an income from food vending.

Lovely aspires to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She doesn’t have any technical skills to financially contribute to the family but she plays her role very well by excellently managing her household expenses. 

She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both of them left their education after matriculation (final examination) and started work. Her son operates an auto workshop. Her daughter operates a beauty salon and is an expert in bridal makeup; her clients are very satisfied with her services.

Shamshad has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her son’s auto workshop business. With the loan investment, he will purchase latest repairing tools and spare parts to offer better quality services to his clients and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Shamshad is confident that her son will successfully be able to improve his business after this investment and she will be able to collect some dowry with increased profits for her daughter’s marriage in the near future.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools and spare parts for her son's auto workshop business.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Teofila has a shop and also peddles clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Teofila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teofila hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Christine is 39 years old and married with six children, all of whom are in school. She has a business selling beer in Kator, South Sudan and she has been doing this for five years. Christine requested this loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC South Sudan, to purchase more beer to sell. She will use the extra income generated from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.en: Mariana is married with one child. She is 62 years old and lives in Mangidkid, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental. Mariana sells assorted goods such as noodles, shampoo, and canned goods to earn a living and she has had this business for less than a year. Each month, she earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase assorted canned goods, noodles, and bottles of shampoo. Mariana has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 9 years.

loans.use: To purchase assorted canned goods, noodles, and shampoo for resale

loans.name: Mergin

texts.en: Mergin works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling vegetables and fruits in the Philippines. Mergin requested a loan of PHP 28,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more spices, vegetables and fruits to sell from her stall. Mergin has been in this business for 11 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more spices, vegetables and fruits to sell from her stall

loans.name: Yot

texts.en: Mrs. Yot is a local farmer in Cambodia. She grows rice crops for her livelihood, earning a profit of $2.00 per day. She is the mother of 5 children, 4 of whom are students living with her while the oldest one works as a laborer and lives far away from the family in Thailand. Her husband is in the business of selling firewood by using a firewood-trailer. This is Yot’s first loan from Kiva and she will use it to purchase 2 additional cows that can be used to haul the firewood-trailer. This loan will help sustain her husband’s business. With the increase in income, she will save to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase 2 additional cows.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en: Rosalina is 57 years old and married with 7 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalina is borrowing PHP 10,000 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs. Rosalina has been raising pigs for 3 years and also earns additional income from selling coconuts. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Annie has a pigpen that sells matured and grown pigs. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Annie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Daylinda

texts.en: Daylinda is 55 years old and lives in Liberad Alto, Sincaban, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. Daylinda has a shop that sells softdrinks. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional cases of softdrinks to sell. Daylinda has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 6 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional cases of softdrinks to sell

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Imelda has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 9,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of clothing to sell.

Imelda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Imelda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en: Nona is 57 years old and single. She lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. To earn a living, Nona operates a general store. She has had this business for 1 year. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 6,000. She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase additional stock for her general store. Nona has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 4 years. In the future, Nona hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her general store

loans.name: Yellow Group

texts.en: Glay was happy with a previous loan which helped him to start a stationary business. He is now requesting another loan to increase his stock of stationary products. His family is happy because he can afford to take care of them. The group is doing fine; that is why they are back for a new loan.

loans.use: To increase his stock of stationary products

loans.name: Analou

texts.en: Analou is 31 years old and married with 4 children who are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Analou has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Analou requested a loan of PHP 11,500 from Kiva's partner, NWTF, to increase her stock of perfumes, body lotions and other personal products. Analou has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Analou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more perfumes, body lotions and other personal products to sell

loans.name: Habibulo

texts.ru: Хабибуло проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 56 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Хабибуло имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии он работает 20 лет. Кроме того он занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа семян пшеницы и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Habibulo lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 56 years old, married and has four children.  Habibulo has a higher, pedagogical education.  He has been working in his field for 20 years.  Besides this work, he is involved in growing vegetables.  He has been in this business for three years.  Habibulo is requesting this loan for the purchase of wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase wheat seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Diane Grace

texts.en:
Diane Grace is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married.

Diane Grace has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Diane Grace has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Diane Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en: Marife is 35 years old and lives in Esperanza, Ramon Magsaysay, Zamboanga del Sur. Marife is married. She has had a vegetable farm for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farm. Marife has been a member of Kiva's partner, PMPC, for 2 years. In the future, she hopes that she can improve her living standards and earn more than she needs for her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 24-year-old married woman with two children who are between the ages of 2 and 4 years old. One of her children is in school. 

Rose has been in the business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan for two years.  She requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more charcoal for resale. She will use her extra income to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Genevieve

texts.en:
Genevieve is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children.

Genevieve has a shop that sells used clothing or ukay-ukay like t-shirts, blouses, and pants. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

Genevieve has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Genevieve hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy stocks of used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica is widowed with one child. She is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Monica is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 15 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer for rice growing. Monica has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Monica hopes to save money in case of emergency.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for rice growing.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children.

Angelina has a tailoring shop that makes and sells school and office uniforms, dresses, and curtains. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Angelina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy materials needed for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 45 years old, married, and has two children. She is from San Jose, Aurora Zanboanga del Sur. 

To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a gardening business, planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. She has been in this business for one year and she earn 2,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Evelyn joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Evelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

location.town: San Jose, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is married, with three children. She is 46 years old and lives in Cagay-anon, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental.

Cresilda sells a variety of fish, shrimp, and crabs to earn a living and has had this business for six years. She has requested loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase more fish, shrimp, and crabs. Cresilda has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish, shrimp, and crabs.

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 27 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with two children.

To earn a living, Melody has a business selling viands (a traditional Filipino dish). She earns about PHP 1,000 each month doing this type of work. Melody has requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy meat and other ingredients for her viand vending business. She has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Melody would like to have her own restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase meat and other ingredients for her viand vending business.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child.

Jessica has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and rice per kilograms. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks, and rice to sell.

Jessica has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jessica hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy canned goods, snacks, and rice to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 60 years old and lives in Cangmalalag, Larena, Siquijor. She is married with six adult children.

Marcelina has a general store and earns PHP 2,700 each month doing this type of work. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to purchase more stock for her general store.

Marcelina has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year.  In the future, Marcelina hopes to sustain her business and to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her general store.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 25-year-old married woman with four children; three of them are in school. She has a business of selling bread in Kator, South Sudan for four years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is married with four children. Tita is 60 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Tita is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for 2 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 14,900  to purchase additional livestock feed and vitamins.

Tita has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Tita hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Ungana Shg Group

texts.en:
Mark is the facilitator of the Ungana SHG group. Mark and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Mark takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Mark had a very good maize yield, harvesting 17 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Mark was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1  acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Mark and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Mark will educate his children, build a house, and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Ungana SHG group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Mark is pictured with his group members in the photograph above

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 58 years old, married with four children and she's from Inasagan, Aurora Zamboanga del Sur. 

Lolita owns and operates a business venture, raising pigs for sale to earn a living. Lolita has been raising livestock for three years and she earn 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Lolita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Lolita wants to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with three children.

Maria has a shop that makes and sells homemade sausage or longganisa. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

Maria has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Maria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for making homemade sausage.

loans.name: Laura

texts.en:
Laura is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children.
 
Laura has a shop that sells vegetables like eggplants, cabbages and string beans. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Laura joined HSPFI as a member in 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lep

texts.en: Lep is a 48-year-old married woman, living in Reussey Keo commune, a suburb area Phnom Penh City. She earns a living by selling merchandise like metal pots, plastic baskets, plates, spoons, and other kitchen supplies. She has spent most of her time outdoor to run this business, from which she usually generates in the neighborhood of $3.00 per day. Her husband also helps her in the same business. With this loan amount, Mrs. Lep will use it to buy a stock of merchandise to sustain her business. In the future, she will save some money to invest and expand her existing business as it is improving.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise to sustain her business.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 35 years old. He is married with five sons and three daughters. Mahmoud is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He wants to improve his family's living conditions by purchasing necessary home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for his children, living room furniture, etc. He doesn't have enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Mahmoud gets the loan, he will be able to purchase the home furniture that his family needs,providing better home living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for his home.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Aida has a karaoke shop that provides entertainment where customer pays 5 pesos per song. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for karaoke services.
Aida has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Aida hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the karaoke services

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is married with seven children. Teofila is 49 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin, Misamis Occdiental.

Teofila sells fish, shrimp and crabs to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 9,000 to purchase variety of fish, shrimp and crabs.

Teofila has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Teofila hopes to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fish, shrimp and crabs.

loans.name: Shahida's Group

texts.en:
Shahida is requesting for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her husband’s grocery store business. With the loan investment, he will buy grocery stock in bulk quantity such as spices, sugar, cooking oil, snacks, etc. This will allow for better customer service in his store and increase his profits and sales.

He is very fair in his rates and treats his clients very respectfully. Shahida has a lot of confidence in her husband and very certain that he will make good use of loan and successfully increase his profits.

Shahida is a housewife and performs her household tasks by staying at home. She is very good in nature and tries to provide comfort to her family with her efforts.

She has given birth to four sons. Two of them work in private organizations while other two are studying.

She is very confident of her husband’s business success after the loan investment and hopeful that it will help her family build a better financial life.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahida.

loans.use: to buy cooking oil, spices, snacks, sugar and other grocery items for a grocery store business

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
Jaime's priority in life is to make his family more economically stable. He is 41 years old and widowed. He has two children who are attending school. In the absence of his wife, he serves as both father and mother to his children. To make a living, he plants and harvest rice. He usually earns about PHP 20,000 every six months.

He needs to improve his crop production so he is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production. He wants to increase the sales of his crops in order to provide a good education for his two children.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and insecticides to ensure good crop production

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en:
Irenea is married with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Irenea is 47 years old and has two children who are in school.

Irenea has a candle making business in the Philippines. Irenea requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her candle making business.

Irenea has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Irenea would like to save enough to provide security for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her candle making.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is a divorced woman with two school going-children. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children.

Halima has operated a food stall for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area residents. She faces a major challenge of seasonality. She dreams of establishing a hotel in the future.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase more stock of wheat, flour and beans for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of wheat flour and beans for her business.

loans.name: Sisimukha Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Sisismukha Group in Western Kenya! Paul is the facilitator of the Sisimukha group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Paul takes care of seven children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Paul had a very good maize yield, harvesting 20 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Paul was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Paul  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Paul will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Sisimukha group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Paul is pictured with his group members in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Rahama

texts.en:
Rahama is a 45-year-old married woman with six children; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling bread in Kator South Sudan for twenty year.

Rahama requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase bread. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase bread for sale.

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 40 years old, married to John and they have three school-going children.  

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs and pesticides for use on her farm during this planting season.

In the future, Susan hopes to improve her farming methods and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area, thereby improving the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs and pesticides.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace used her previous loan to lease land farming as well as buy fertilizer and seeds for planting. She was able to plant and harvest, thereby becoming very profitable.

She paid all her previous loan amounts well and in good time. This will be her seventh loan and she plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer and plant potatoes and carrots during this planting season.

In the future, Grace hopes to improve her farming skills and get more income and be able to pay school fees for her school-going children as well as improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Josie makes and sells viands and snacks like rice cakes and pancakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks.

Josie has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Josie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands and snacks

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 13 years.  He is 47 years old, married to Peris, and they have three school-going children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be his second loan.  He paid all his previous loan well and in good time.  He plans to use the loan amount to buy fertilizer and seedlings as well as for labor purposes and spraying chemicals.

In the future, Samson hopes to improve his farming skills and become one of the leading farmers in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings.

loans.name: Chuon

texts.en: As shown in the picture, Chuon, a 44-year-old married woman, is sitting in her small store in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. These days, her store is almost empty of products because she has run out of stock. The purpose of this loan is to buy stock of merchandise such as snacks, cigarettes, canned foods, sweets, shampoos and other necessary things to restore her stock again. She is now living with her husband and 3 single children.

loans.use: to buy a stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 42 years old, married with two children and she's from Poblacion 1, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. 

To make a living, Margie owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling pork barbecue and chicken barbecue in the market. Margie has been in this business for four years and she earns 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Margie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Margie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 16th loan taken out by Margie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase his stationary stock.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en: Bakari is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her retail shop business. With the loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of beans and wheat flour. Bakari is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva Lenders for giving her loan to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To  buy  food stuff like wheat flour, catering margarine, baking tins .

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa is 52 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Leonisa has a shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy fish to sell.

Leonisa joined HSPFI as a member in 2011. In the future, Leonisa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a 26-year-old married woman with three children, two of them are in school. She has a business of selling clothes in Kator South Sudan for one year.

Vida requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase clothes. She will use her extra income from this loan to buy a plot for her children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for sale.

loans.name: Bidii Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Bidii SHG Group in Western Kenya! Elizabeth is the facilitator of Bidii SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elizabeth is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund due to the best training facilities in farming offered by the firm and also to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elizabeth had a good maize yield, harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elizabeth was only able to harvest 6 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elizabeth and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Elizabeth will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in business.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Biabu

texts.en:
Biabu is a married woman with two school-going children. Her husband, who is employed, contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her children. 

Biabu has operated a firewood selling business for the past four years; in addition she also sells cereals. Her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of insecurity. She dreams of establishing a cereals shop.

With the KES 15,000, she wants to purchase more stock of firewood and cereal for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of firewood and cereal for resale.

loans.name: Elesia

texts.en:
Elesia is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with six children.
 
Elesia has a shop that sells vegetables like eggplants and string beans. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Elesia joined HSPFI as a member in 2011. In the future, Elesia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Manzooran's Group

texts.en:
Manzooran is 35 years old. She is very active and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. Her passion with her work enables her to create new designs which increases her sales and profits every month.

Her husband is a contractor as well as an animal seller. He purchases goats and sheep in their younger age from an animal market and then sells them for profit after raising them.

He has vast experience in this field and knows the ups and downs of his business very well.

Manzooran is the mother of three daughters and a son. Two of them study while the other two are not yet of school age.

She is requesting a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s animal sales business. With this loan investment, he will purchase goats and sheep in larger numbers and selling them to butchers at a profit.

Manzooran is hopeful that her husband will have greater success in his business after this loan investment.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for animal selling business

loans.name: Dolorita

texts.en:
Dolorita is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Dolorita has a shop that sells abaca products like abaca weave and abaca cloths. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for making abaca weave.

Dolorita has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Dolorita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for making abaca weave

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with four children, two of whom are enrolled in school, while the other two are still young for school. Her husband is a public vehicle driver who contributes to the provision of the family's basic needs. She owns a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanamisi has operated a beauty salon for the past four years; her potential clients are the local area ladies. She faces a major challenge of seasonality, where demand is high during the festive season only. She dreams of expanding her business.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase a hair dryer for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access fund for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a hair dryer for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar is a 42-year-old woman and a mother of two children.

Entesar is requesting a loan of 400 JD to purchase clothes for trading purposes.

Entesar is looking to expand her business and increase her sales volume.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra, age 21, married immediately after graduating from high school. She and her husband have a child who is old enough now that Myra can join her husband in providing an income for their small family. They are farmers. Their primary challenges are providing food for the family and paying essential utility costs.

She is requesting a loan of P10,000 to utilize as capital in buying rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming. 

In the future, she wants to achieve abundant harvests to provide enough sustenance for her family and to set aside enough money to allow for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy rice seedlings, fertilizers, and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 30-year-old married woman with three children between the ages of 2 and 8 years; two of them are in school. She has had a business of selling charcoal in Kator, South Sudan, for four years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Sherly

texts.en:
Sherly is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Sherly is making and peddling snacks like rice cakes and banana cues. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Sherly has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Sherly hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis has been in the cattle sales business in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 17 years. He is 43 years old and married to Mary, and they have three school-going children.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more buy cows so as to boost his business.

In the future, Francis hopes to invest more in his business and sell cattle to other parts of the country, thereby getting more income to pay school fees for his children as well as improve the living standards for his family.

loans.use: To buy more cows for sale.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 41 years old, married with four children, and from Baclay, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

To make a living, Aida is running a general store, selling a variety of food and home products to the local community. Aida has been in the business for eight years, and she earns 15,400 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. Aida hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Narynkul

texts.ru:
Нарынкуль  57 лет, замужем. Основная деятельность  семьи Нарынкуль – животноводство и полеводство.  В 2005 году, Нарынкуль решила расширить свою деятельность за счет откорма и перепродажи скота, вложив в первоначальный закуп скотины 2,000 сом (KGS). 
На сегодняшний день,  хозяйство Нарынкуль насчитывающее 10 баранов и одну корову, приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 6,000 сом. Также, Нарынкуль возделывает 3,20 поливной земли, где выращивает пшеницу, ячмень, клевер и картофель. Доходы от бизнес - деятельности Нарынкуль позволили дать образование ее детям, ставшими преподавателями. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нарынкуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Нарынкуль планирует направить на реконструкцию сарая для скота.  В будущем, Нарынкуль также хочет расширить свою деятельность за счет открытия продуктового магазина в своем селе.
texts.en: Narynkul is 57 years old and married.  Animal husbandry and farming is the primary business of Narynkul's family.  In 2005, she decided to start her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock and investing an initial amount of 2,000 som (KGS) into the purchase of livestock.  Today, her business has 10 sheep and one cow and yields a monthly income of 6,000 som (KGS).  Narynkul also has 3.2 hectares of arable land, where she grows wheat, barley, clover and potatoes.  Earnings from this business allowed her to provide education for her children, who became teachers.  In order to further grow her business, Narynkul requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep.  She plans to use the income from the loan to repair a barn for livestock.  In the future, Narynkul also wants to expand her business by opening a food market in her village.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merlita has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for ten years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Merlita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Merlita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and  beverages

loans.name: Elyse

texts.en:
Elyse is 27 years old and is married with two children between the ages of two and five years old.
He owns a business of transporting people. This is his first year in this business and he works from 6am until 10pm every day.

Elyse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror, etc.) to help him in the business. With his profits, he will be able to save for his future and to pay medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts (tire, mirror, and engine) for his motorcycle.

loans.name: C 1922 Twitezimbere Group

texts.en:
Bernadette is 42 years old and is married with five children aged between four and 18 years old. Bernadette is also the leader of this group, which is called "Twitezimbere" in the local language and she is the third person from the right side, who is in the African clothes. She sells various goods such as: cassava flour, rice, beans, etc. She employs two people to help her and she has one year of experience. 

Bernadette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more cassava flour, rice, beans, etc. to sell. With any profit, she hope to reinvest in her business, to save for her future, and she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava flour, rice, beans, etc to sell.

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen is married and has one son who is currently 2 and a half years old. Her husband has been working hard to manage his grocery store, which sells food and household supplies to local customers. 

He has more than five years of experience and he has a deep understanding of local consumers. He has a good reputation and he is well-known in his area.

To help expand his business, Yasmeen has requested a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. The loan will be used to buy more household supplies for the business and will help her husband to generate greater profits and improve the family's welfare.

loans.use: To buy household supplies for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 28-year-old single man from Marka, Amman, Jordan.

Sameer has a restaurant and he is requesting a loan of 1,500 JD to purchase goods needed for expansion.

He is looking to open a new branch of his restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase goods needed to expand his restaurant

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Sam is a rice cultivator from Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. She is a mother of four children, three of whom are working in a garment factory as part of a sewing staff.

Besides farming, Mrs. Sam runs a general store from her house, selling a variety of products as shown in the picture. She typically earns about $2.50 a day through this business.

Sam would like to borrow 1,000,000 KHR to finish repairing parts of her house. With the rest of this loan, she will buy seed and fertilizers for growing her dry-season rice. She is very appreciative to all lenders who kindly help her family.

loans.use: to repair parts of her house and buy rice seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Bibi

texts.en:
Bibi is a married woman with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Bibi used the funds from a previous loan to purchase bundles of handbags for sale. Using the previous loan, Bibi was able to expand her assortment of products and increase her profits. Now Bibi desires another loan because she anticipates an increase in prices and has decided to purchase merchandise in advance at lower prices.

Bibi values the loans she has obtained and considers it unacceptable to be late on payments even by one day.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of handbags for sale.

loans.name: Gennetta

texts.en:
Gennetta is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Gennetta has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Gennetta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gennetta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Whitney

texts.en:
Whitney is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Whitney is making and peddling snacks like rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

Whitney has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Whitney hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Wesakulila Shg Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Wesakulila SHG Group in Western Kenya! Fred is the facilitator of the Wesakulila SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Fred is a father of three children. He joined One Acre Fund in order to have additional maize profits to educate his children and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Fred had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Fred was only able to harvest three bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Fred and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Fred will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Khudoikul

texts.ru: Худойкул занимается купле- продажей скота более 6 лет. Он женат. Его жена домохозяйка, а он сам кормит семью. Он покупает скот на рынке, а потом в течение 10 дней откармливает и продает за выгодную цену. Худойкул хочет улучшить свои жилищные условия, а для этого ему необходимо заработать много денег. Чтобы расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль он запрашивает займ в размере 1000$ США. На полученный займ он хочет купить скот, чтобы пополнить свой оборотный капитал. Он надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас.
texts.en: Khudoikul has been involved in buying and selling livestock for over six years.  He is married, and because his wife is a homemaker, he supports the family on his own.  He buys livestock at a market, fattens it up for ten days and then sells it at a profitable price.  Khudoikul wants to improve his living conditions and needs to earn a lot of money for this.  He is requesting a loan in the sum of $1000 to expand his business and make a good profit.  He wants to buy livestock with the obtained loan, so that he could refill his revolving capital.  He relies on your help and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Hernane

texts.en:
Hernane is 55-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 8 children. 

Hernane has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and electronic loads of several networks from GLOBE & SMART. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods and electronic loads for selling.

Hernane has been a member of HSPFI since 2009. In the future, Hernane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and electronic loads for selling.

loans.name: Jean Pierre

texts.en:
Jean Pierre is 36-years-old and is married without children.

He owns a business of transporting people. This is his seventh years in this business and he works from 5am until 10pm every day.

Jean Pierre has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase spare parts (tires, engine, mirror) to help him in the business. With the profits, Jean Pierre will be able to build a house and to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts (tires, engine, mirror) to help him.

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 82-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children.
 
Vicenta has a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for copra. She has had this business for 11 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

Vicenta has been a member of HSPFI since 1996. In the future, Vicenta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and bananas for selling.

loans.name: Nicson

texts.en:
Nicson aims to acquire higher output every harvest season from his farming business. Harvest season usually falls during the months of April and November. He involved himself in rice farming as source of his income because he was not able to seek better employment. He had once worked as a security guard but moved into rice farming. 

Nicson is 31-years-old, married and has one child.

He would like to ensure good crops from his farming business but he has inadequate funds to sustain his rice field. In this regard, he is asking for a loan of P10,000 to buy four bags of rice seed and 12 bags of fertilizer to use in farming.

In the future Nicson would like to make his family more economically stable.

loans.use: to buy four bags of rice seed and 12 bags of fertilizer to use in farming.

loans.name: Samuel Ochieng

texts.en:
Samuel is a 23-year-old married man and has a son who is one year old. He describes himself as self-motivated and focused.

Samuel operates a tailoring store in Nairobi where he sells apparel for women and men, and children’s clothes as well. He has been involved in this business for two years. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funding. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more material for making clothes for women.

His business goal is to be a supplier of clothes within five years.

loans.use: to buy more material for making clothes for women.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 42-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children.
 
Helen has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like fried fish, adobo and pancit bihon. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands.

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
