Nasreen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who is a rickshaw driver and provides transportation services to his passengers. With the loan investment, he will pay the remaining installments on his rickshaw. This will make the rickshaw his own property and he will be able to run it more freely and increase his profits.

He is a very good driver and also provides pick-up and drop-off services to different school children. Parents of school children trust his driving and offer him good money for that purpose.

Nasreen is a seamstress and works for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and never compromises on quality. Her principal of not compromising on quality helps her in attracting more customers toward her.

She is the mother of five children; two of them are studying while the others are young and haven’t started their education. She is very hopeful that her step of receiving a loan from Asasah will have a good impact on her husband’s business.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nasreen.

loans.use: To pay the remaining installments on the rickshaw.

loans.name: John Muia

texts.en: John is a 34-year-old married man. He has 2 children aged 2 and 7 years. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a carpentry retail store where he sells furniture. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in Ongata Rongai. John describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of a strategic place to locate the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy timber. His business goal is to get a strategic place for his furniture making within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy timber.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
Cristy is a 36-year-old married woman with 6 children. The oldest child is 18 years old and the youngest is 7 years old.

Cristy and her husband run a fishing business in Panglao, Bohol. Fishing is their main source of income. Cristy does her best to improve their business and sustain their family. She applied for a loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. Cristy hopes for their business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets.

loans.name: Tohirjon

texts.ru: Тохирджон отец троих детей, любящий семьянин. Жена работает поваром. Они уделяют особое внимание воспитанию и образованию детей. Тохирджон предоставляет услуги такси в своем городе. Также у него дома крупный рогатый скот. После откорма продает и получает прибыль. Он хочет получить займ на покупку несколько голов скота. Он знает, что на свете есть добрые люди, которые всегда готовы протянуть руку помощи нуждающимся. Он надеется получить займ в размере 4000 сомони для покупки КРС. Он заранее благодарен всем.
texts.en: Tohirjon is a father of three children and a loving family man.  His wife works as a cook.  They pay special attention to raising and educating their children.  Tohirjon provides a taxi service in his city.  He also has cattle at home.  He sells livestock after fattening it up and earns a profit.  Tohirjon wants to obtain this loan to purchase several heads of livestock.  He knows that there a kind people in the world, who are always ready to extend a helping hand to the needy.  He hopes to get a loan in the sum of 4000 somoni to buy cattle.  Tohirjon thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has three children ranging from the age of twenty-two to twenty-seven. She describes herself as an honest woman. She runs a restaurant where she sells food to new and has frequent customers. Her business is faced with the problem of inadequate capital to add her stock. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to buy maize and wheat flour. In the future, Alice wants to run several restaurants.

loans.use: To add stock of wheat and maize flour, rice, etc.

loans.name: Liberthe

texts.en:
Liberthe is 41 years old and is married with two children between the ages 5 and 10 years old. Liberthe sells pub items (beer and drinks like Primus, Fanta, Amuster and so on). She has three years of experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Liberthe starts from 7 a.m. until 10 p.m. every day.

Liberthe has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more beer like Heineken, Amuster, Primus and so on. With the profit from the loan, she will reinvest in her business and save money for her future.

loans.use: To purchase more beer (Heineken, Amuster, Primus, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Njete Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Njete SHG Group in Western Kenya! David is the facilitator of the Njete SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

David takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, David had an excellent maize yield harvesting 22 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, David was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to David and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, David will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Njete SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured with his group members in the photograph as shown.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is married with 3 children. Thelma is 68 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Thelma is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 15,000 to  purchase fertilizer for her rice crops.

Thelma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Thelma hopes to save money for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice crops.

loans.name: Betty Kawira

texts.en: Betty Kawira, 33 years old, is married and has a two-year-old son. She describes herself as a hopeful woman. She has been running a grocery store for the past six years. Her business is faced with the problems of customers delaying their payments and increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm products. In the next five years, Betty wants to expand her business by increasing the turnover of the goods sold.

loans.use: To add stock of farm products.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en: Hayat is a 33-year-old married woman with five children. All of them are in school. She has had a business selling cold drinks in Kator, South Sudan for five year. Hayat requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase soda and water. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a permanent house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase soda and water for sale.

loans.name: Safarali

texts.ru: Сафарали 67 лет. Он женат. У него шестеро детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Сам Сафарали занимается скотоводством. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности занимается три года. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов телят и бычков.
texts.en: Safarali is 67 years old, married and has six children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Safarali is involved in animal husbandry.  He earns a living by breeding cattle and has been in this business for three years.  Safarali is requesting this loan for the purchase of several calves and bulls.

loans.use: to purchase several calves and bulls

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, married, with four children. She is from Inasagan, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Elizabeth operates a business raising pigs for sale. Elizabeth has been in this business for 7 months and she earn 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2011, Elizabeth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feeds and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feeds and other supplies

loans.name: Roselinda

texts.en:
Roselinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines.

Roselinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more recycled materials to sell.

She has been in this business for 3 years.

Roselinda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 51 years old. She is married to Philip, who is employed and brings additional income to the family. She has operated a posho (corn grinding) mill for the last 21 years, with an income of 30,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) a month.

She has never borrowed from any other MFI, and this is her eighth loan after successfully paying the previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase maize and repair the posho mill.

With the anticipated profits, she plans to support her family and pay school fees for her children. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To purchase maize and repair the posho (corn grinding) mill.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is married with five children. Norma is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Norma is a farmer and fattens pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 Philippines pesos to purchase livestock feeds and vitamins. 

Norma has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Norma hopes to see her children finish college.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feeds and vitamins.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is married with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Emma is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Emma has a shells craft business in the Philippines. Emma requested a 50,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to buy more shells for her shells craft business.

Emma has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Emma would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more shells for her shells craft business.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Gemma earns a living through selling fish. She is married with two children, aged 20 and 18. Gemma's husband is a fisherman.

Gemma has been selling fish for two years. She sells her husband's catch at the market. She also buys fish from other fishermen in her town. Gemma works hard to support her family. She requested this loan to purchase an icebox, weighing scale and plastic bags. Gemma hopes for her business to grow.

loans.use: to purchase an icebox, weighing scale and plastic bags.

loans.name: Cristy

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Cristy works hard to support her family.
She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Cristy is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy a fishing net and other equipment for her fishing business.
Cristy has sustained her business activities with her four previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a fishing net and other equipment

loans.name: Yokub

texts.ru: Ёкуб примерный семьянин, заботливый  отец пятерых детей. Жена домохозяйка. Вместе с детьми они ведут хозяйство по разведению крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. У них  своя ферма. На ферме работают все дети после занятий. Он старается  воспитать детей  трудолюбивыми. Он запрашивает займ для постройки дома и надеется в поддержке добрых людей. Он верит в то, что получит займ и заранее благодарен тем, кто предоставит его.
texts.en: Yokub is an exemplary family man and a caring father of five children.  His wife is a homemaker.  Together with the children, they run a business of breeding cattle and small livestock and have their own farm.  All of the children work on the farm after school.  Yokub tries to raise his children to be hardworking people.  He is requesting this loan to build a house and hopes to get the support of kind people.  He believes that he will get this loan and thanks those, who provide it, in advance.

loans.use: to build a house

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Mrs. Pich is now 67 years old, a widow and the mother of seven children. Five of her children are already married and live independently. Mrs. Pich is in the business of cultivating rice crops. She is able to yield a profit of $3.00 per day, but it is barely enough to cover her daily expenses. In order to improve the living conditions, her son, Mr. Sen (22) decided to work as a blacksmith for an entrepreneur in the province. Over the past few years, Mr. Sen has learned a lot from his work experiences. Now he wants to run this type of business for himself in his commune. Mrs. Pich is a helpful mother; she is also encouraging her son to start doing this work. So now she has applied for a loan from Kvia to purchase some of the materials necessary to support her son’s new business. She hopes the new business will earn a good income for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase some of the materials necessary to support her son’s new business.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia is divorced and lives with her father. She is a mother of two boys and one girl who are 9, 5 and 4 years old. 

She doesn’t want to become a burden on her parents; that’s why she manages the financial expenses of her children from her sewing business. She receives good orders from her neighboring clients and earns well after completing them on time.

Her father is a local entrepreneur and operates a business selling watches. He sells a variety of watches such as wall clocks, wristwatches, etc., to his customers. He sells them by visiting different areas and streets and attracts customers by announcing in a loud voice.

Asia is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her father’s business. Her father will use the loan in buying watches of different varieties to increase his sales and profits.

Asia is very confident about her father’s business growth after the loan investment.

Note: One of the members sells artificial flowers; that is why they are holding flowers in the photo.

loans.use: To buy watches of different varieties for selling.

loans.name: Sonny

texts.en: Sonny is 35 years old. He is married and has one child. He has been involved in the farm business for 10 years. He has one and a half hectares of land, where he grows corn. He sells his harvest to traders and earned about 35,000 PHP from his last crop. The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his family and give his child a higher education. Thus, Sonny wants to obtain a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and corn seedlings. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested to further growth his business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and corn seedlings

loans.name: Moris Maina

texts.en:
Moris is 30 years old and married. They have a three-year-old daughter. He describes himself as a focused man. 
He has offered a passenger transportation service in Nakuru town for the last two years. His business is faced with the problem of inadequate funds to buy spare parts. He will be using the Kes 50,000 loan to buy spare parts for the motorcycle. 
In the future, Moris wants to own ten other motorcycles for the same business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Ms. Hoa,48 years old with two children, She has participated in loans from  our credit program  in 2007 and she is always in good repayment situation. She has  received 6 loans. She has a shop that sells motorcycle parts.Her monthly gross income is 6,000,000 Vietnam dong. Now,she wants to borrow  9,632,000 Vietnam dong to buy more motorcycle parts to attract more clients to come.

loans.use: to buy more motorcycle parts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Tessito Gadamayo/ Jokker Endam Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Jokker Endam  est créé le 15 Novembre 2006 au jour d’inauguration du banc villageois. Il compte 22  femmes qui vivent dans la même localité. Leur activité principale est le petit commerce.

Madame HAWA (assise à l’extrême droite) est responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 51. Elle est mariée et mère de sept enfants et deux neveux à sa charge.

Elle est vendeuse de légumes dans le marché de son quartier. Elle maîtrise bien cette activité. Elle a en son actif plus de 3 ans  d’expérience.

Ce nouveau  crédit lui permettra d’acheter des légumes pour les revendre dans son marché.

Les bénéfices lui permettront  de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la scolarité et santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The Jokker Endam group was created on the 15th of November, 2006, on the inauguration day of the village's "banc villageois". The group is made up of 22 women who live in the same village and are all involved in small retail.

Hawa, sitting on the far right of the picture, is the group's leader. She is 51 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. She also takes care of 2 nephews. She sells vegetables at her local market and is a capable saleswoman with over 3 years of experience in the business.

Her part of the loan will allow her to buy vegetables that she can resell at the market. She will use her profits to support her husband with the children's educational and medical expenses.

loans.use: to restock on vegetables for resale at the local market.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр проживает в районе Хамадони. Он женат. Ему 26 лет. У него трое детей. Он уже 12 лет занимается скотоводством. В основном он разводит скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Кредит берет для закупа двух телят.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 26 years old, married and has three children.  He has been involved in animal husbandry for 12 years.  Bakhtiyor primarily breeds livestock for future sale.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of two calves.

loans.use: to purchase two calves

loans.name: Renato

texts.en: Renato is 47 years old and is married. He earns a living by growing corn in the Philippines. Renato is borrowing PHP 30,000 to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. Renato has been farming corn for fifteen years and earns approximately PHP 15,000 last crop season. He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of his dream: to save money to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Esther Alouch

texts.en:
Esther is 27 years old, married and has three children ranging from four to eleven years old. She describes herself as a humble, talkative and God-fearing woman. 
She has been selling clothes and vegetables for the last ten years. Her business is faced with the challenge of the increased price of goods. 
Esther will be using the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of vegetables and used clothes. In the future, Esther wants to run a boutique.

loans.use: To increase her stock of clothes and vegetables.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for maintenance

loans.name: Norman

texts.en:
Norman is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Norman has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. He has had this business for eight years. He requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Norman has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Norman hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Marwa

texts.en:
Marwa is a 33-year-old married woman from Al Hashmi, Amman, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Marwa is requesting a loan of 800 JD to do home maintenance.

Marwa is looking to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to do home maintenance

loans.name: Sadiri

texts.en:
Sadiri is a 24-year-old married man. He resides in Saranay, Angadanan, Isabela. Sadiri operates a business venture in the agriculture sector - planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. He has been in this business for 2 years. Every season, he earns 25,000 Philippines Pesos (PHP) doing this type of business. 

Sadiri requested a loan of 40,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and corn seedlings. In the future, he wants to lift his family out of poverty.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and corn seedlings.

loans.name: Weonia Shg Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Weonia SHG Group in Western Kenya! Peninah is the facilitator of the Weonia SHG group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peninah is a mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Peninah had a good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Peninah was only able to harvest three bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peninah and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Peninah will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Weonia SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

She is pictured in the photograph with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of spices and vegetables for selling.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children; three of whom are in school. She runs a fuel wood store, which has been in operation for the last four years.
Agnes was invited to Milango by her friends and she decided to join in order to access credit. She is now applying for a loan of Ksh 100,000 to purchase charcoal and fire wood. Her main challenge has been the lack of capital to purchase more stock.
Agnes looks forward to being the supplier of fuel wood in the future. The income obtained from such a venture will go a long way towards helping her educate her children. She is full of praise for Milango and its partners for the support she has received.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal and fire wood.

loans.name: June Rose

texts.en:
June Rose is 38 years old and is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 20 years old.
June Rose has been raising hogs for three years. She plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. Each month, June Rose earns 10000 PHP in the hog raising business.
In the future, June Rose would like to expand her piggery and make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sacks of rice to be sold retail.

loans.name: Marvin

texts.en: Marvin is 20-years-old, single and lives with his parents in the village where he plants and harvests corn that he sells to traders. He wants to lift his family from poverty. That's why he devotes himself to his corn farming business. He has managed his corn farming business for over five years and earned about PHP 27,000 with his last crop. Marvin wants to borrow PHP 30,000 to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizers for his farm. He hopes to maintain his business to secure his family's future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticides and fertilizers for his farm.

loans.name: Millicent Nyiero

texts.en:
Millicent 45 years old, married and has five children ranging from one to thirteen years old. She describes herself as a humble woman. 
She has been a tailor for the last four years. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of materials and clothes. In the future, she wants to run and expand a large tailoring shop business.

loans.use: To add to her stock of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Domitille

texts.en:
Domitille is 37-years-old and is married with two children, 16 and 18-years-old. Her business is clean and good. She owns a sewing business. She has fifteen years experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Her business runs from 7am until 7pm every day except on Sunday. 

Domitille has requested a loan from Kiva via the Vision Finance Company in order to expand her sewing business by buying a new machine. With any profit from the loan, Domitille will expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to expand her sewing business by buying a new machine.

loans.name: Khusrav

texts.ru: Хусрав женат и у них двое детей. Более 4 лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного и мелкого скота. Он еженедельно покупает скот на рынке, а затем откармливает их  до следующей недели, а потом продает за выгодную цену. Хусрав запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и благодарен вам за ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Khusrav is married and has two children.  He has been involved in buying and selling cattle and small livestock for over four years.  He buys livestock weekly at a market, fattens it up until the following week and then sells it at a profitable price.  Khusrav is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.  He relies on your help and thanks you for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en:
Prisca is 26 years old and is married with two children. Her business is well, clean, and good. She sells various goods, such as cooking oil, water, bananas, sugar, etc. She has 2 years of experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business starts from 6am until 7pm every day except on Sunday.

Prisca has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company to purchase various goods, such as cooking oil, water, bananas, sugar, etc. to sell. With any profit from the loan, Prisca will expand her business to save for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purcase various goods, such as cooking oil, water, bananas, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Elika is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Elika and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Elika takes care of eight children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizers and hybrid seed and to ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Elika had a very good maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Elika was only able to harvest ½ bag of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Elika and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Elika will educate his children and invest in renting more farmland for more production.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Elika is pictured with her group members. The person standing on the far left is the field officer.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
60-year-old Margarita runs a sari-sari store business in Panglao, Bohol. She is married and has three children.
Margarita has had her sari-sari store for 10 years. She sells items like bath and detergent soap, shampoo and canned goods to her community. 
Margarita works hard to support her family. She requested this loan to buy more items to sell, such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods. Margarita hopes to earn more and be able to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as rice, soft drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en: Virgilio is 36 years-old. He is married and has two children. They live in Saranay where he manages their corn field. He had been in his farm for ten years. Due to an unexpected typhoon, he received only P12,000 from his last crop. His wife also does hog-raising business for additional family income. They are both thankful because the income they generate from their businesses helps them to provide their daily needs and to be able to continue sending their children to school. Now, Virgilio is requesting a loan of P40,000 in order to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business. He hopes that he can get the amount he requested and he is promising to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: to purchase corn seedlings and fertilizers for his corn farm business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional electronic loads to sell.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Julienne is 29 years-old and is married with two children aged four and seven years old. Julienne takes care of one additional child. Her business is well clean and good. She sells fruits such as:  avocadoes, bananas, lemons, etc. Julienne has 12 years experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Her business starts from 7am until 6pm every day of the week except on Sunday.

Julienne has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more fruits such as: avocadoes, bananas, lemons etc. to resell. With any profit from the loan, Julienne will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase various fruits such as: avocadoes, bananas, lemons, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is 37 years old and married to Isaac, who is employed and brings additional income to the family. They have two children, who go to school.  She has run a boutique for the last three years, with an income of KES 30,000 a month.
She has never borrowed from any other MFI and this is her second loan, after having successfully paid off the previous loan well and in good time. She will use the entire loan to buy more stocks of cosmetics and new dresses to sell during the festive season.
She plans to support her family and pay school fees for her children with the anticipated profits. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To add stock to the business.

loans.name: Moka Olie B Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Moka Olie B Group in Western Kenya! Pamela is the facilitator of the Moka Olie B group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Pamela takes care of four children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Pamela had an excellent maize yield harvesting 26 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Pamela was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Pamela and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Pamela will educate her children, build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Moka Olie B group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 38 years old and is married with three children aged between 1 and 15 years old. Her business is well, clean, and good. She sells African clothes. She has 5 years of experience in this business and employs two people to help her. Her business starts from 7am until 6pm every day.

Rose has requested a loan from Kiva lender Vision Finance Company to purchase more African clothes to sell. With any profit from the loan, Rose will expand her business to save for her future and to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase  more African clothes to sell.

loans.name: Florencia

texts.en:
Florencia is 59-years-old and is a married woman with 4 children. She has been in the hog raising business for 3 years. Each month, Florencia earns 8000 PHP with her business. She works hard to support her family and improve their living situation.

Florencia plans to use her loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. She hopes for her business to be progressive. Florencia also wishes for her family to be healthy and successful.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 28-years-old, married, and a mother of one child. She runs a boutique in Mwembe Tayari in Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last five years. The business is doing well.

This marks Catherine’s first borrowing from KADET to finance her business and with the money she plans to purchase more stock of clothes in her boutique. 

With the anticipated profits she hopes to be able to repay back her loan and to expand her business even further. She hopes to do well in business and to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of clothes for her boutique.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 43-year-old married mother of four children. She operates a food kiosk in Bombolulu Mombasa, a business that has been in operation for the last two years. The business is doing well.

This marks Christine’s second borrowing from KADET LTD to finance her business and with the money she plans to purchase more foodstuffs for her food kiosk. She plans to buy rice, cooking oil and flour. 

With the anticipated profits she hopes to be able to repay back her KADET loan and to expand her business even further. She hopes to do well in business and to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase more foodstuffs for her food kiosk. She plans to buy rice, cooking oil and flour.

loans.name: Faiyza

texts.en: Faiyza is a 45-year-old woman. She is married with five sons and two daughters. She has a food stall for selling bean snacks, which is the only source of income for the family. Faiyza wants to purchase a large quantity of bean snacks to resell and increase her income, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Faiyza gets the loan, she will be able to purchase more bean snacks. She will have better quantity to resell and increase her income and will create better living conditions for her family. Faiyza is a conservative and religious woman, so her son Mohammad who is 19 years old is photographed instead in the stall.

loans.use: To purchase more bean snacks to sell.

loans.name: Rogel

texts.en: Rogel is from Cauayan City, Isabela. He is the proud father of three children. Rogel helps to support his family through their family farm. He is married to Jonalyn who has helped him to manage their family farm for 15 years. He is known for being a hardworking and honest person. At this time, he would like a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farming business. According to his plan, this investment will increase his income. In addition to helping his children, Rogel dreams of renovating the family home. Even though life is difficult, he enjoys being a farmer living in Philippines.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seedlings for his farming business.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. Rosalyn is making and peddling snacks like banana cue, butchi, and shakoy. She has had this business for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.
Rosalyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rosalyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

loans.name: Bibizar

texts.ru: Бибизар занимается растениеводством. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем. У нее шестеро детей. Ее муж тоже занимается растениеводством, он в основном занимается посевом зерновых культур. Сама Бибизар одиннадцать лет как занимается выращиванием овощей и посевом пшеницы. Она берет кредит для посева озимой пшеницы.
texts.en: Bibizar is involved in agriculture.  She is 50 years old, married and has six children.  Her husband is also involved in agriculture and primarily sows cereal crops.  Bibizar has been involved in growing vegetables and sowing wheat for eleven years.  She is requesting this loan for sowing winter wheat.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Enecita

texts.en: Enecita is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. Enecita has a shop that sells canned goods, soap, and detergent. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, soap, and detergent. Enecita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Enecita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soap, and detergent.

loans.name: Ezechiel

texts.en:
Ezechiel is 39 years old and is married with six children. He owns a sewing business. He starts from 8am until 8.30pm every day except Sunday and he currently employs three people to help him. Ezechiel has 10 years of experience in this business.

Ezechiel has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by buying more materials for his sewing. With any profits, Ezechiel will be able to save for his future, reinvest in his business, and buy a motorcycle to help him.

loans.use: To expand his business by buying more materials for his sewing.

loans.name: Geronimo

texts.en: Geronimo is 26 years old and is married. His main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He has 5 years of experience in this field. He earns about PHP 25,000. Geronimo is asking for a loan of 25,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his farm. Future loans from Kiva would be invaluable to him as he sees the loans as the only opportunity for the development of his business and financial security.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

loans.name: Onchiri

texts.en:
Austin is 25 years old single and she support his two brothers. She operates a M-pesa business and she has been in business for 3 years and right now her monthly income from the business is KES. 40,000.

She has applied for a loan of KES. 30,000 to expand the flow of M- pesa and airtime cards. She plans to have a stable business with the anticipated profit from the business.

This is her fist loan and her hope and dream is to stabilize her business.

loans.use: to expand the flow of M- pesa and airtime cards for sale.

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene is 36 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Gene has a shop that sells clothing and beauty products from Natasha and Avon. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy additional stock from Natasha and Avon.

Gene has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Gene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock from Natasha and Avon to sell.

loans.name: Jennie

texts.en:
Jennie is 43 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 

Jennie has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Jennie has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jennie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Clotilde

texts.en:
Clotilde is 41 years-old and is married with five children aged between 6 and 21 years-old. Her business is well, clean and good. She sells various goods such as: soap, biscuits, drinks (Fanta, juice, water, etc.). She has six years experience in this business and employs three people to help her. Her business starts from 6am until 9.30pm every day except Saturday. 

Clotilde has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance company in order to purchase various goods such as: soap, biscuits, sugar, drinks (Fanta, juice, water, etc.) to sell. With any profit from the loan, Clotilde will expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as: biscuits, juice, water, soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Amua Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Amua Group in Western Kenya! Joseph is the facilitator of the Amua group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joseph takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family, access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure good produce on his farm. In the recent 2011 season, Joseph had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on 1/2 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joseph was only able to harvest two bags of maize on 1/2 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joseph and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Joseph will educate his children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Amua group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

He is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Stephen Muiruri

texts.en:
Stephen used his first loan amount to buy sugar, rice and flour in bulk so that he could package and resell them in small quantities in his retail shop, hence making a good profit.

He paid the loan amount well and in good time. He plans to use this loan amount to buy more inventory of potatoes and carrots for selling in his business as another source of income.

In the future, Stephen hopes to establish a big entrepreneurship business and become one of the leading businessmen in Naivasha.

loans.use: to increase his stock  of  potatoes.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 31 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Analyn has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for one year. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Analyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Kopiya Farmers Group

texts.en:
Peter is the facilitator of the Kopiya Farmers Group, Peter and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Peter takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Peter had a very good maize yield harvesting nine bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund,  Peter was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Peter and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Peter will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Kopiya Farmers Group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Peter is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia is 38 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Letecia has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages . She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 in order to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

Letecia has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Letecia hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan has operated her clothing sales business in Naivasha town for the last 10 years.  She is 44-years-old, married to Samuel and they have two children in school.

She was introduced to KADET  LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes for sale in her business.

In the future, Susan hopes to expand her business and get more income to open a big boutique thereby becoming one of the leading business ladies in Naivasha.

loans.use: to add more stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a Tuk Tuk (motorcycle taxi)  for her son to start working for a Tuk Tuk service.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. Amelita has a shop that sells clothing, like t-shirts, blouses , jackets & pants. She has had this business for 1 year. She requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy stock of clothing to sell.  Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of clothing tos ell

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has requested a loan from KIVA partner, Asasah, for her husband, who wants to repair his auto rickshaw because its engine is causing problems. This will allow him to provide better quality transport services to his passengers and increase his profits. By using the loan, he will also be able to save his precious business asset, which is the only source of income for him.

Sughran is a housewife  and spends her time staying at home and doing her household tasks. She has given birth to 4 children. All of them are enrolled in a local school and getting their education. Both Sughran and her husband know about the importance of education and want their children to become successful in life by getting the latest education.  Sughran has a lot of confidence in her husband and is very sure that an investment will help him get more benefits from his business and improve the living standard of the family.
Note: "In the photo, the lady holding the book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sughran."

loans.use: To repair auto rickshaw for transport business

loans.name: Mussarat's Group

texts.en:
Mussarat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s carpet weaving business.  The carpet weaving business has always been very popular and it always gets good acknowledgment from the people.  With the loan, he will buy carpet weaving tools and thread in bulk quantity that will allow him to make better-quality carpets and realize higher profits.

Mussarat is 48 years old and a mother of 5 children. She stays at home and takes care of her family by fulfilling their needs.  Her husband is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Mussarat is hopeful that an investment will help him expand his business and improve the financial condition of her family. 
Note: “In the photo, the lady holding a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Mussarat”.

loans.use: To buy weaving tools and thread for carpet weaving business

loans.name: Tuinuane B Group

texts.en:
Julius is the facilitator of the Tuinuane B group. Julius and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Julius takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, to ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Julius had an excellent maize yield harvesting 21 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Julius was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Julius and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Julius will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Tuinuane B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Yet

texts.en:
Yet is a 38-year-old mother of five children, all of whom are still living with the family. They work in the rice field and they work for others. She is a farmer in the rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She also plants cassava to generate additional income. She has been farming on her rice field for 12 years and planting cassava for 5 years. Yet can earn around six US dollars per day to feed her family. 

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy cassava trees for her plantation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to grow more cassava and earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for her plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sael

texts.en:
Sael is a 32 year-old young man.   He is married and has three sons and two daughters.  He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary and he also works in agriculture to improve his income. Sael wants to prepare the green houses well for the coming winter's agricultural season by purchasing seedlings, fertilizers, etc,, but he hasn't enough money to pay for them.
   
He needs to take a loan of $2,000 from FATEN. When Sael gets the loan, he will purchase what he needs to have better crops.  Then he will compete with others and increase his sales in agriculture.  That will increase his income and offer his family better living conditions. Sael is photographed in his green house.

loans.use: To prepare the green houses for the season by purchasing seedlings, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Ablavi est une femme  âgé(e) de 46 ans. Elle est mariée å un  chauffeur. Elle a 05 enfants. 
Ablavi travaille comme revendeuse de boissons depuis 2003. Elle  achète les produits à Lomé. Elle a un bar.
Ablavi a requis son cinquième  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des boissons.
Dans les prochaines années, Ablavi voudrait ouvrir d’autres points de vente afin de satisfaire plus la demande.
texts.en:
Ablavi is 46 years old and the mother of 5 children. She is married to a driver and has been selling drinks since 2003. She has a bar and gets her supplies in Lomé.

Ablavi is requesting her 5th loan from WAGES so that she can restock on drinks. In the coming years, she would like to open more sales outlets in order to be able to better satisfy customer demand.

loans.use: to restock on drinks.

loans.name: Gulnoroy

texts.ru: Гулнорой жительница Яванского района. Возраст, 43 года. Замужем, имеет пятерых детей. Ее муж работает в дехканском хозяйстве. Сама Гулнорой при доме имеет небольшой участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Gulnoroy is a resident of the Yavan district.  She is 43 years old, married and has five children.  Her husband works at a dekhan farm.  Gulnoroy has a small plot of land by her house, where she grows vegetables.  She has been involved in this business for 10 years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en: Amelita is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children.  Amelita has a shop that sells fish, like sardines, & beverages . She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 11,000 to buy fish to sell.  Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr:
Koffi est  un homme âgé de 38 ans. Il est marié å une tresseuse et ont ensemble 03 enfants.
Koffi travaille comme reporter -Vidéo depuis 2000. Il a une entreprise dans laquelle il répond à la demande de ses clients dans un quartier de la place. Il achète ses outils à Lomé.
Koffi a requis son sixième crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter de la Caméra.
Il dit qu’avec les profits, Il prévoit assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants.
texts.en:
Koffi is 38 years old and married to a braider. The couple have 3 children. Koffi has been working as a video reporter since 2000, and has a business which fulfills the demands of customers in his local neighbourhood.

Koffi buys his tools in Lomé and is requesting a 6th loan from WAGES in order to buy a camera. He plans to use the profits from his business to provide his children with a better future.

loans.use: to buy a camera.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a hard working married man with  five children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns rentals as  his source of income but faces challenges of  high taxes and tenants not paying on time. His personal goals are educating his children and building more rental houses to increase on his income. Abdallah needs the loan to renovate his rentals.

loans.use: to renovate his rentals.

loans.name: Sulton

texts.ru: Султон трудолюбивый и честный юноша. Он холост. Последние 3 года он занимается откормом скота. Он работает усердно, чтобы помогать своим родителям в  содержании семьи и улучшения  условий. Он покупает скот на рынке,  откармливает и продает. Он хорошо ухаживает за скотом и когда они набирают вес, продает за хорошую цену. Султон запрашивает займ для расширения бизнеса и хочет достичь успеха.
texts.en: Sulton is a hardworking and honest young man.  He is single.  He has been involved in fattening up livestock for the last three years.  Sulton works diligently, so that he could help his parents to support the family and improve their conditions.  He buys livestock at a market, fattens it up and sells it.  He takes good care of the livestock, and, when it gains weight, sells it at a good price.  Sulton is requesting this loan to expand his business and wants to achieve success.

loans.use: to expand his business

loans.name: Krombon Group

texts.en:
Clement is the facilitator of the Krombon group. Clement and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Clement and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Clement takes care of nine children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food to ensure food security for his family and to have a difference in the production rate of his harvest. In the recent 2011 season, Clement had an excellent maize yield harvesting 17 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Clement was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Clement will educate his children and save for future use.

In 2012, the members of Krombon group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Clement pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en: Madilyn is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 11 children.  Madilyn has a pigpen that sells grown & matured pigs. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy animal feeds for the pigs.  Madilyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Madilyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds for the pigs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old married man living in Fort Portal,Uganda. His current business is transportation which he started five years ago as another person's driver but later managed to get money and buy his own car. 

The challenges he has faced are price fluctuations leading to high fuel costs. His personal goals are building a permanent house and educating his children. Joseph needs the loan to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his motor vehicle.

loans.name: Nambako Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Nambako SHG Group in Western Kenya! Moses is the facilitator of the Nambako SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Moses takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Moses had an excellent maize yield, harvesting 13 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Moses was only able to harvest 5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Moses  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Moses will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Nambako SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Moses is pictured in the photograph with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 6 children.  Arlene has a shop that sells coconut shells and wood charcoal by the sack. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy wood & coconut shells for charcoal making.  Arlene has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Arlene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy wood & coconut shells for charcoal making

loans.name: Jematian

texts.en:
Jematian is 37 years old, married and the mother of two children. She has sold clothes in the town of Eldama Ravine for the last four years and made a good income.
She has never borrowed from any other MFI and this is her second loan, after having successfully paid the previous loan off well and in good time. She will use the entire loan to buy more stock of clothes and clothing material to make dresses to sell.
She plans to support her family and pay school fees for her children with the anticipated profits. She hopes to be financially stable in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of clothes and clothing material to make dresses to sell.

loans.name: Deo

texts.en:
Deo is a 30-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He farms mainly vegetables and tomatoes. 
He faces the challenge of pests and diseases, which affects his output. His personal goals are educating his children and building a permanent home; his business dream is a big tomato farm. Deo needs the loan to buy chemicals to spray his tomatoes.

loans.use: to buy chemicals to spray his tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To restore the house's entrance.

loans.name: Sitine

texts.en:
Sitine is 28 years old and is married.  She has two children. Sitine takes care of two relatives between 10 and 16 years old. She owns a business of transporting people.  She has a motorcycle driver to do it.  She also owns a clothes business, where she is pictured. This is her first year in this business and she works from 7am until 10pm every day except Saturday.

Sitini has requested a Kiva loan, via Vision Finance Company, in order to purchase a new motorcycle to help her in her business. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, to pay medical insurance and to build another house for her family.

loans.use: To buy new motorcycle.

loans.name: Zikrullojon

texts.ru: Зикруллочон занимается шитьем чехлов для мебели и салона автомобиля. В этой области он пять лет. Ему 25 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Он просит кредит для покупки тканей и новой швейной машинки.
texts.en: Zikrullojon does sewing of slipcovers for furniture and automobile seats. He has been in this business for five years. He is 25 years old, married and has one child. He is asking for a loan to buy fabrics and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en: Loreta is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single and has 3 children. Loreta has a shop that sells snacks, like rice cakes & banana cue. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 7,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.  Loreta has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Loreta hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a hardworking young woman living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She sells used shoes. 
She used to sell for someone else but then started her own business from the savings she had made while working for another person. The challenges she faces include: Price fluctuations, customers not paying on time and inadequate capital to buy more stock. 
Her personal goal is to build a permanent home. Her business goals are moving her business to a more permanent location and expanding the business into new markets. Agnes is targeting the Christmas season and needs the loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Adrie

texts.en:
Adrie, age 38, owns and operates a general store. She and her husband have a seven-year-old child and also take care of Adrie's older sister. In her store, she sells various goods such as biscuits, water, toothpaste, and soap. She has operated her business for one year and works from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. daily. She currently employs one person to help her.

Adrie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase goods to sell in her store. With the expected profits, she is confident that she will be able to reinvest in her business as well as to pay for medical insurance.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of goods to offer for sale in her general store

loans.name: Christa Joriz

texts.en:
Christa Joriz, age 23 and unmarried, owns and operates a general store business where she sells such items as canned goods, snack foods, and beverages. She has had this business for three years.

Christa joined HSPFI earlier this year and dreams of improving her business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 7,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is a 26 year old married man with five children living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family dream is educating his children and setting up a permanent building. He has been riding a motorcycle for the last three years where he has faced challenges of high fuel prices and the bad roads bringing about mechanical breakdowns. His dream is to buy another motorcycle so as to increase his income. Andrew needs the loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy  another motorcycle.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas has operated his metal and welding business in Naivasha town for the last 12 years. He is 47 years old, married to Roselyne and they have two children, who go to school.  
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our existing clients and this will be his second loan. He paid off all his previous loan amount well and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more stocks of metals for sale, so as to sustain his business.
In the future, Thomas hopes to invest largely in the metal and welding business and open up other garages in Naivasha town and other places.

loans.use: To buy more stocks of metals for sale

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie, age 34, runs a general store business to earn a living. She has operated this business for 12 years. She sells such items as canned goods, shampoo, detergents, and soaps. Analie and her husband have three children.
 
Earlier this year, Analie joined HSPFI. She hopes to make improvements to her business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, soaps, detergents, and shampoo to offer for sale in her store.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, soaps, detergents, and shampoo to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun, 48, is divorced and has two children, one of whom is still living with the family and works at the rubber plantation. To earn a living, Savoeun just started selling groceries 1 year ago. She sells biscuits, candy, detergent, cooking oil, etc. She also works at the rubber plantation to raise additional income. Nowadays, she can earn around 7 US dollar per day to feed her family. 

Savoeun is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy grocery stock for her store. This loan will enable her to have more inventory, and she hopes to earn more income to feed her family.

loans.use: to buy grocery foodstuffs for her store.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Edward

texts.en: Edward is a 40-year-old single parent with five children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children. He operates a poultry project which he started six years ago, and his challenge is inadequate capital to buy poultry feeds. He dreams of rearing 2,000 birds by 2013. Edward needs the loan to buy chicken feed.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Odette

texts.en:
Odette is 30 years old and is married with three children aged between 3 and 9 years old. Her business is clean and good. She sells various goods such as lotions, toilet paper and drinks (Fanta, juice, etc.). She has five years of experience in this business and employs one person to help her. Her business starts from 7 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Odette has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, toilet paper and drinks (Fanta, juice etc) to sell. With any profit from the loan, Odette will expand her business and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as lotions, toilet paper and drinks (Fanta, juice, etc.) to sell.

loans.name: Virgilio Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Virgilio tiene 57 años de edad trabaja en su casa en la ciudad de Concepción, en donde tiene su taller, su esposa es la Sra. Maria, ella es ama de casa, ellos tienen dos hijos varones, ya todos mayores de edad.
Virgilio tiene una taller de autos desde hace ya varios años, este ha sido el medio gracias al cual ha podido mantener y sacar adelante a su familia. El se considera una persona muy trabajadora y humilde, ya que el viene de una familia de escasos recursos, pero gracias a su esfuerzo ha podido salir adelante.
El solicitó este créditos para la compra de repuestos para poder levantar algunos vehículos que tiene para poder hacer trabajar. El posee numerosos cliente fijos ya en su taller lo cual hace que su trabajo sea muy constante.
texts.en:
Virgilio is 57 years old and works from home, in the city of Concepción, where he has a car repair shop.  His wife, María, takes care of the house.  The couple have two sons who are both adults.

Virgilio has had a car repair shop for several years.  This business is how he has managed to support and provide for his family.  Virgilio considers himself to be a very hard-working and humble person as he comes from a poor family.  However, thanks to his hard work, he has managed to get ahead in life.

Virgilio requested this loan to buy spare parts to fix some vehicles that he has so that he is able to work.  He already has a lot of regular customers and so has a constant stream of work.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to fix some vehicles

loans.name: Liene

texts.en: Liene is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. Liene has a shop that sells snacks like chicharon. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippines pesos to buy raw ingredients for making snacks. Liene has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Liene hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is a 30-year-old married man with three children, living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children. He operates a retail shop which he started three years ago and faces a challenge of lack of capital. Richard needs the loan to buy sugar and salt for resale.

loans.use: to buy sugar and salt for resale.

loans.name: Azela

texts.en:
Azela is 28 years old and is married with two children aged between 3 and 5 years old. Her business is well, clean and good. She sells notebooks, pens, books, etc., in her stationery store. She has two years experience in this business. Her business starts from 8 a.m. until 5 p.m. all week except on Sunday. 

Azela has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her stationery store by buying more goods such as notebooks, pens, books, etc., in her store for resale. With any profit from the loan, Azela will expand her business and save for her family.

loans.use: To expand her stationery store by buying more goods such as notebooks, pens, books, etc., in her store for resale.

loans.name: Myla Jane

texts.en:
Myla Jane, age 23 and unmarried, has a shop that sells footwear and beauty products from MSE. She has run her business for two years. 

She joined HSPFI earlier this year. Her goal is to make improvements to her business.

She has requested a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 in order to buy stocks of MSE products to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy stocks of MSE products to offer for sale

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul, age 42, owns a business selling second-hand clothes at the local market. He works from 8 a.m. until 6 p.m. Monday through Saturday. He currently employs one person to help him.

He and his wife have four children: the youngest is a two-month-old baby and the eldest is 16 years old.

Paul has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more second-hand clothing and bags to offer for sale. With the expected profits from the loan, Paul is confident that he will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more second-hand clothing and bags to offer for sale

loans.name: Ra'fat

texts.en:
Ra'fat is a 23-year-old young man. He is married with two daughters. He wants to improve his situation and provide to his family better living conditions by increasing his income. 

Ra'fat wants to purchase some necessary home appliances such as a stove, refrigerator, etc., and to improve his income, he wants also to prepare for opening a cafe that serves hot drinks such as tea, coffee, etc. Ra'fat hasn't enough money to pay for all these expenses, so he needs to take a loan of $3,000 from FATEN. When Ra'fat gets the loan, he will improve his family's living conditions by purchasing the necessary home appliances, and improve his situation by opening the cafe for better income. This will help Ra'fat to live with his family in better life conditions. Ra'fat is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase some necessary home appliances and prepare to open a cafe.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr:
Afi est une femme âgé(e) de 33ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur et a 05 enfants.
Afi travaille comme revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale depuis 2010. Elle vend à domicile à ses clients après avoir acheté à Lomé.
Afi a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits d’alimentation générale.
Le profit réalisé lui servira à aider son conjoint et à prendre en charge les besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Afi is 33 years old and married to a driver. The couple have 5 children. Afi has been selling groceries since 2010. She gets her supplies in Lomé and resells them from her home.

Afi is requesting her first loan from WAGES so that she can restock on groceries. She plans to use her profits to support her husband and take care of the children's needs.

loans.use: to buy groceries for resale.

loans.name: Weoya Shg Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Weoya SHG Group in Western Kenya! James is the facilitator of the Weoya SHG group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

James takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to feed his family and be able to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds to ensure proper yield from his farm. In the recent 2011 season, James had a very good maize yield, harvesting 14 bags on 3/4 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, James was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 3/4 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to James  and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, James will educate his children and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Weoya SHG group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

James is pictured with his group members in the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sokon

texts.en:
Sokon is a 58-year-old mother, widowed, and has one child who is living with the family and works for others. She has been planting cassava to support her living for three years. She also works for others to raise additional income. Sokon currently can earn less than five US dollars per day to feed her family. 

Sokon is requesting her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy cassava trees for her plantation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to make more cassava and earn more income to feed her family better.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for her plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Margie is making and peddling snacks like sweetened cassava and cassava cakes. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy raw ingredients in making snacks.

Margie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Margie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Upendo Group

texts.en:
Jacktone is the facilitator of the Upendo group. Jacktone and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Jacktone and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Jacktone takes care of five children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to improve his maize production and grow enough food to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Jacktone had an excellent maize yield harvesting 18 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Jacktone was only able to harvest 2 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With income from maize sales, Jacktone will save for the future and educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Upendo group will each plant maize plots of between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Jacktone is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Shoirakhon

texts.ru: Шоирахон целеустремленная и добросовестная женщина. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Она шьет женскую одежду, национальные курпача и подушки. Она принимает также индивидуальные  заказы. Она хотела бы получить займ для покупки новой швейной машинки, а также тканей для пошива платьев, курпачи и подушек. Она надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
