texts.en: Shoirakhon is a purposeful and honest woman. She is married and is raising three children. She sews women's clothing, traditional mattresses and pillows. She also takes custom orders. She wants to take out a loan to buy a new sewing machine as well as fabrics for making of dresses, mattresses and pillows. She is hopeful for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine as well as fabrics for sewing of dresses, mattresses and pillows.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 44 years old and is married with six children aged between 1 and 6 years old. He owns a business of supplying various materials for sewing. He starts from 7.30am until 6pm per week except on Saturday.

Paul has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business by supplying various materials for sewing. With any profits, Paul will be able to save for his future and to reinvest in his business.

loans.use: To expand his business by supplying various materials for sewing.

loans.name: Augustine

texts.en: Augustine is a 40-year-old married man with 8 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He sells fish and has been in this business for ten years. He has challenges such as limited capital, price fluctuations and theft, especially when transporting fish from the suppliers. His goals are to educate his children and to expand into new markets. Augustine wants money to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees.

loans.name: Moka Olie Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Moka Olie Group in Western Kenya! Concalata is the facilitator of the Moka Olie group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Concalata takes care of six children at home. She joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Concalata had a very good maize yield harvesting 16 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Concalata was only able to harvest four bags of maize on one acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Concalata and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Concalata will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Moka Olie group will each plant between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ndongo Mar

texts.fr: Monsieur Ndongo vit au Sénégal depuis plusieurs années.  Il est âgé de 29 ans.  C’est un célibataire qui  évolue dans  le milieu de l’animation en sono depuis 9 ans. C’est parce qu’il aime beaucoup  la musique et qu’il avait l’habitude d’accompagner chaque weekend les animateurs  de son quartier   a aller sur le terrain qu’il a finalement opté pour ce métier. En plus il est intéressé  par le fait qu’il puisse se prendre en charge financièrement grâce  a ses revenus. Il est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il vit il y’a 2 ans. Il sollicite un crédit de 70 000 frs prévu pour le renouvellement de son matériel sono en vue de préparer la  période des  fêtes  qui approche. Ce financement lui permettra de mieux développer son activité, de conquérir  d’autres marchés et en fin augmenter son chiffre d’affaire.
texts.en:
Mr. Ndongo has lived in Senegal for several years. He is a 29-years-old single man who has been part of the music amplification scene for the past nine years. He finally opted for this profession because he loves music and he used to accompany neighborhood social workers each weekend in their field work.

He was also interested by the fact that he could financially support himself thanks to his earnings. He is a member of the branch office of U-IMCEC close to where he has been living for two years.

He is requesting a loan of 70,000 francs destined to renew his sound equipment in preparation for the approaching holiday season. This funding will allow him to better develop his business, conquer other markets and ultimately increase his turnover.

loans.use: renew sound equipment

loans.name: Jean D`amour

texts.en:
D`amour is 29 years old and is married with one child who is eleven years old. His business is well organized. He sells canteen items such as: cakes, Fanta, juice and water. He has two years of experience and employs one person to help him.

D`amour has requested a loan from kiva lender via vision finance company in order to purchase more food and drinks such as: cakes, Fanta, juice and water for resale. With any profit from this loan, D`amour will reinvest in his business and to save for his future.

loans.use: To purchase more food and drinks such as: cakes, Fanta, juice and water for resale

loans.name: Mirian Gloria

texts.es:
La señora Mirian es Soltera, vive en la Ciudad de Curuguaty, comenta que tiene una peluquería bien equipada gracias a la cual ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia.
Cuenta que se dedica a esto hace 18 años, por lo que ella misma dice que experiencia tiene de sobra. Gracias a la peluquería que tiene puede ayudar con los gastos y la manutención de la casa.
En cuanto a su clientela nos cuenta que siempre tiene mucho trabajo por lo que le genera muy buenos infresos. Desea seguir creciendo para que algún día pueda convertirse en una gran peluquera.
Ella solicita el crédito para la refacción de su salón de belleza, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo y seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirian is single and lives in the city of Curuguaty.  She says that she has a well-equipped hairdressing salon which has enabled her to get ahead in life and help her family.

Mirian says that she has been in this business for 18 years and so has plenty of experience.  Thanks to the hairdressing salon that she has, she is able to cover her expenses and help support her household.

As regards her customers, Mirian tells us that she always has a lot of work, which makes her very good income.  She would like to continue growing in her business so that some day she can become a great hairdresser.

Mirian is requesting this loan to refurbish her beauty salon so that she can continue growing her business and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy materials with which to refurbish her beauty salon

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Thoeun, 55, is married and has five children, three of whom are dependent. One of them is still in school while the other two work at the rice field and plantation. To make a living, she has been farming on her rice field for 30 years. She alS. plants cassava and raises pigs to generate additional income to feed her children. Currently, she can earn less than seven US dollars per day.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy cassava trees for her plantation. She hopes that this loan will enable her to make more cassava and earn more income to feed her family better and alS. keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for her plantation.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Amelita is making & peddling snacks like banana cakes, banana cue & rice cakes . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy raw ingredients in making snacks for sell.
Amelita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Amelita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients in making snacks for sell

loans.name: Mary Wambui

texts.en: Mary is a 39-year-old married woman. She has 6 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 18 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a boutique where she sells ladies' bags, shoes and trousers. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in Gilgil Shopping Centre. She describes her biggest business challenge as the increased cost of goods. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy ladies' clothes, handbags and shoes. Her business goal is to sell potatoes using lorries within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock of ladies' clothes, handbags and shoes.

loans.name: Tassie

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Tassie.  She is a widow and has no children, but has 6 dependents who are her relatives and also relatives of her late husband. In 2009, Tassie established her toiletries and provision sales business, such as sardines, ovaltine, milk, sugar, etc. She began her business because she needed to help her husband support their home. Tassie never went to school so her only means of livelihood is petty trading. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,200,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Tassie requires a loan in order to buy more toiletries, sardines, ovaltine, milk and sugar to add to her business stock. In the future, Tassie plans to open her business in different areas of the city. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more toiletries, sardines, ovaltine, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Mercy Kathao

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 10 years to 25 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located at Kilindine in Maua town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of home products. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock to her retail shop.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac a 37-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda, with 4 children. He wants a loan to purchase cocoa. He has been trading in his cocoa business for seven years. His personal goals include educating his children. He is faced with some challenges in his business, such as seasonal weather, high transport costs and price fluctuations, and his dream is to trade wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase cocoa.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is happily married to an OFW (Overseas Filipino Worker). Currently, he both stands as father and mother to his three children. His main priority nowadays, is to increase his income through improving his rice farming business. Edwin is a responsible and industrious person. 

Edwin owns and manage his rice fields for almost 25 years. He is glad because despite his hardships and difficulties in raising his children still he is able to devote his time in cultivating his farm land. He is indeed grateful, because he have enough strength to face challenges in life. Edwin would like to let his children finish their studies because education is the only thing he could give to his children. To make his dreams come true, he is requesting for a loan P30,000 which will serve as his additional capital in buying farm inputs to make his rice field more productive.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for his agricultural business

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines.  He is separated with 1 child. 
Rodrigo is providing motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for 3 years. He requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.
Rodrigo has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future,Rodrigo hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for his transport service

loans.name: Yon

texts.en:
Yon, 47, is married and lives in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She has four children who work in a rice field and a rubber factory. She has been farming on her rice field for 25 years to make a living. She also grows vegetables. She has been growing vegetables for 4 years to generate additional income. 

Yon currently earns around 15 US dollar per day to feed her family. Now she is applying for a first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy construction materials for her new house. This loan will enable her to have a new house to accommodate her children.

loans.use: to buy materials for house construction.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Abror

texts.ru: Более 3 года Аброр занимается купле- продажей и откормом скота. Он покупает скот на рынках кишлака, откармливает дома в течении 20 дней, а затем дороже продает на местном рынке. Он начал свой бизнес с мелкого рогатого скота. Он хочет получить хорошую прибыль, чтобы помочь своим родителям. Аброр запрашивает займ для покупки крупного рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса, который позволит ему улучшить уровень жизни. Заранее он хочет поблагодарить всех КИВА кредиторов за их помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Abror has been buying and selling as well as feeding cattle for more than three years. He buys the cattle on the markets of his village, feeds it at home for twenty days and then sells at a more expensive price on the local market. He started his business with a small horned cattle. He want to make more profit and help his parents. Abror is asking for a loan to buy large horned cattle with a goal to grow his business which will let him improve the quality of life. He wants to thank all the Kiva lenders in advance for their help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Masaba Umoja B Group

texts.en:
Edwin is the facilitator of the Masaba Umoja B group. Edwin and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Edwin takes care of three children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Edwin had an excellent maize yield harvesting 13 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Edwin was only able to harvest seven bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Edwin and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Edwin will build a house and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Masaba Umoja B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a 30-year-old married woman. She has a son who is 4-years-old. She describes herself to be aggressive, determined and focused. She operates a retail store where she sells potatoes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in the Langalanga shopping centre in Nakuru town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds to buy potatoes. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to purchase bags of potatoes. Her business goal is to sell potatoes using lorries within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy bags of potatoes.

loans.name: Mo'taz

texts.en:
Mo'taz, age 21 and unmarried, is a farmer. He lives with his family, all of whom depend on agriculture for their living. 

Mo'taz and the family have a piece of land that needs to be restored to a state in which it can be optimized for planting and harvesting crops. Mo'taz intends to purchase agricultural supplies, seedlings, and fertilizers in order to prepare the land as well as possible for the growing season. Since Mo'taz and his family lack the money to pay for these agricultural necessities, he is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. 

When Mo'taz receives the loan proceeds, he will be able to pay for improvements and repairs to the family land. He and his family will benefit from growing, harvesting, and selling its products in the future to increase the family income and improve their lives.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, seedlings, and fertilizers in order to prepare the land for the growing season

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Damaris is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Damaris and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Damaris and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Damaris had an excellent maize yield harvesting 14 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Damaris was only able to harvest six bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Damaris will educate her children and save for the future.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Damaris pictured with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sopheak

texts.en:
Sopheak, 47, is married and lives in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She has 4 children and all of them are still in school. Presently, she is a farmer and she also plants cassava to raise additional income for her family. She has been in this business for 17 years. Her husband works as a construction worker to additionally generate income. 

Sopheak has been with VisionFund since 2009. The loans from VisionFund help her to feed her children and send her children to school regularly. She completely repaid the loans with VisionFund. She is now requesting for a third loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy a plot of plantation land to grow more cassava. This loan will enable her to grow more cassava and she hopes to earn more income to better feed her family and also keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a plot of plantation land to grow cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Khursheed's Group

texts.en:
50-year-old Khursheed lives with her 2 sons. Both of them work to financially contribute to the family. Her elder son is a driver by profession and drives a rickshaw. He facilitates his passengers' travel with his driving services. Her youngest son provides his loading services as a loader. He drives a donkey cart and delivers goods such as construction supplies (cement, bricks, etc.) to designated places.

She herself is a housewife and manages her household responsibilities by staying at home. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her youngest son who wants to buy a new donkey cart for his business because his current cart has rotted in different areas and doesn’t allow him to load heavy items on it.  By purchasing a new cart, he will be able to provide better quality loading services to his customers and increase his profits.

Khursheed is confident that after the loan investment, his business will become more profitable.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book (called an Asasah Passbook) is Khursheed.

loans.use: to buy a new donkey cart for loading business

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: B., a 41-year-old man, lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda with 3 children. He deals in a poultry product business where he keeps layers, broilers and young chicks. He has challenges in his business such as high prices for chicken feed, limited capital for expansion, theft and some customers don't usually pay on time. His business goal is to operate a large scale production and his personal goal is educating his children B. wants money to purchase chicks and poultry feed.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher a 28-year-old man who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He owns a retail shop in town and sells plastics like cups, plates, and basins among other things. He is faced with challenges such as limited capital for expanding his business, few customers and a persistent increase of prices in the market due to inflation. His goal is for him to have a well-built permanent house and to expand his business into new markets. Christopher wants a loan to buy plastic cups, plates, basins, jericans and jugs for sell.

loans.use: to purchase plastic cups, plates, basins, jericans and jugs for selling.

loans.name: Nargis

texts.ru: Наргис проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 43 года. Она разведена. У нее двое детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Сама Наргис у себя дома занимается выпечкой булочек и их реализации через сеть продуктовых магазинов. Таким образом она зарабатывает деньги и обеспечивает семью. Кредит берет для покупки муки, масла, яиц и сахара.
texts.en: Nargis lives in the Qumsangir region. She is 43 years old. She is divorced. She has two children, both in school. Nargis bakes rolls at home and sell them through a network of grocery stores. This is how she earns her living and supports her family. She is taking out a loan to buy flour, butter, eggs and sugar.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, eggs and sugar

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shoes and fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: reinforce her business assets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia is a 25-year-old married woman with 2 children, living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She has a firewood business. Her personal goal is to have a good house and educate her children. She is faced with challenges such as limited capital in the business and high firewood costs. Nadia needs the money to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.use: to purchase firewood for resale.

loans.name: Sean

texts.en:
Sean,59, is married and lives in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She has ten children, seven of whom are dependents, working at the rice field and tailor shop. To earn a living and feed her children, she has been farming on her rice field for 40 years. Before the loan, she earns less than 8 US dollars per day to feed her family. 

Now applying for a first loan with VisionFund,Sean will use this loan to buy fertilizer for her rice field and use some of the loan to build a small tailor shop for her daughter. With this loan, she hopes she can earn more income to build on some savings for future needs, especially for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her rice field and to build a small tailor shop.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is married with two children. He is engaged in rice farming and owns a motorcycle transport business. Roberto and his wife enjoy their farming activities. They both work hard to become successful farmers someday. His wife has been involved in a hog raising business to help her husband in earning profits for their living. 

Roberto is happily living with his wife and one grandchild in the village of Aguinaldo Cordon. He considers himself an expert farmer since he has been managing his rice fields for almost 31 years. He believes that he could cover all their household expenditures and improve his lifestyle. One of the ways thought up by Roberto to obtain his goal is borrowing additional capital from lenders. He is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to allow him to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for the labor cost of his hired laborers in transplanting and sowing rice crops on his farm land. This would be a great help to him and for his whole family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies and pay for the labor cost of his hired laborers in transplanting and sowing crops on his farm land

loans.name: Wilberforce

texts.en: Wilberforce is a 34-year-old married man with 3 children who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has a butchery business in town but has limited capital for expansion, and he would like to expand into new markets. His main objectives include educating his children and having a well built permanent house for his family. Wilberforce wants money to purchase bulls for slaughtering ahead of the Christmas season.

loans.use: to purchase bulls for slaughtering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve the condition of her house

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: Tabitha is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 11 years. She describes herself to be honest and ambitious. She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in Maua town. She describes her biggest business challenges to be the increased cost of goods when buying them, and maintenance. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of home products. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock to her retail store.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 47-year-old married father of two children. He owns and runs a welding and painting garage in Bombolulu, Mombasa. The business has been in operation for two years.

This marks Alfred’s second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the money he plans to purchase paint and new equipment for welding and painting. 

With the anticipated profits, he hopes to be able to repay back his KADET loan and to expand his business further. In the future, Alfred hopes to become a successful businessman in Mombasa and to have a happy family

loans.use: to purchase paint and new equipment for welding and painting

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Thea, 39, is divorced and has four children, who are still with the family and work at the rice field, on the plantation, and work for others. She is a farmer in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She also plants cassava to raise additional income to feed her family. Sometimes, she works for others as well. She has been farming on her rice field and planting cassava for 15 years and three years respectively. Currently, she earns less than four U.S. dollars per day. 

Thea is applying for her first loan with VisionFund. She wants to buy cassava trees for her plantation. She hopes that she will grow more cassava and earn more income to build some savings for her future needs.

loans.use: to buy cassava trees for her plantation

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be ambitious and optimistic. She operates a grocery retail store where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located at Athiru gaiti in Maua town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add to her stock of cereals. Her business goal is to triple the stock within five years.

loans.use: to add to her stock of cereals

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is  33 years old, married, and a father of two children. He owns and runs a retail shop in Vikwatani, Mombasa and the business has been in operation for four years.

This marks Oscar’s third loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the money, he plans to purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and margarine for his shop. 

With the anticipated profits he hopes to be able to repay back his KADET loan and to expand his business further. In the future, Oscar hopes to become a successful businessman in Mombasa and to have a big shop.

loans.use: to purchase bales of maize and wheat flour, sugar, and margarine for his shop

loans.name: Arise And Shine Group

texts.en:
Samwel is the facilitator of the Arise and Shine group. Samwel and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Samwel and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Samwel takes care of one child at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to acquire new technology in production. In the recent 2011 season, Samwel had a very good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Samwel was only able to harvest three bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Samwel will save for the future and invest in livestock rearing for future use.

In 2012, the members of Arise and Shine group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Samwel with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Safargul

texts.ru: Сафаргул замужем. Она заботливая и трудолюбивая женщина. Более 4 лет она занимается купле- продажей разных видов посуды. Она имеет широкий ассортимент посуды, у неё в магазине можно найти набор европейской и национальной посуды. Её торговая точка находится на центральном рынке города, там, где много людей. Товар востребуемый. Сафаргул хочет увеличить ассортимент товара, и она хочет расширить ассортимент товара  и приобрести стеклянную посуду. С этой целью она запрашивает займ в размере 700$ США.
texts.en: Safargul is married. She is a caring and hard-working woman. For over four years, she has been working as a vendor of different types of dinnerware and drinkware. She has a wide assortment of goods. In her store there is a selection of European and national drinkware. Her vending facility is located at the central market of her town, where there always many people. Her goods are in demand. Safargul would like to expand and diversify her stock of goods by buying glassware. For this purpose she is requesting a loan in the amount of US $700,-.

loans.use: to buy glassware

loans.name: Angelina Katuu

texts.en: Angelina is married and has five children ranging from eleven to nineteen years.She describes herself as an understanding, active, and punctual woman. She runs a salon where she renders her services to local residents at Gataka in the Rongai Shopping Centre. Her beauty salon is faced with the problem of customers delaying their payments. She will use the loan of Kes 20,000 to buy braids and chemicals. In the future, Angelina wants to be a wholesaler and supplier of her beauty products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy braids and chemicals.

loans.name: Ann Ngirote

texts.en:
Ann is single and has two children who are two and six. For the past four years, she had been selling timber. Ann describes herself as an honest woman. Her business is faced with the problem of fluctuating timber prices.

Ann is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to purchase timber. She looks forward to having a well-equipped business.

loans.use: to buy timber

loans.name: Simon Maina

texts.en:
Simon has been selling new clothes for the past five years and he earns a monthly income of 15,000 KES which he uses to support his family. He has repaid his previous loans in good time.

Simon is requesting his third loan with KADET LTD to buy new clothes to add to his business. He will expand his business with the anticipated profit from his loan. Simon’s hopes and dreams are to open a wholesale boutique which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell for the festival season

loans.name: Douglas Muriuki

texts.en:
Douglas is a 27-year-old married man with a one-year-old son. For the past two years, he has run a store where he sells home products. Douglas describes himself as an honest man and his business is located in Maua town. He biggest business challenges are inadequate funds, low purchasing power from his customers, and transportation difficulties when buying goods. 

Douglas is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to buy sugar, rice, maize, and flour. Within five years, he hopes to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, maize, and flour

loans.name: Wafaa'

texts.en:
Wafaa' is a 29-year-old young woman and she is married with two sons and four daughters. Her husband is a worker with a decent salary.

Wafaa' has a project of raising poultry. She wants to purchase a huge amount of fodder to feed the poultry, but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan amount of $1,000 from FATEN.

When Wafaa' gets the loan, she will purchase the amount of fodder she needs to feed the poultry. This will increase her product and she will benefit from selling them to increase the family's income and to live in better conditions. Wafaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for poultry

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is 55 years old and is married to Jasper, who is a businessman. The couple is blessed with three children, ages 24, 26, and 30. Violet is a businesswoman who has run a medical clinic for the past ten years. She earns a monthly income of 20,000 KES which she uses to support her family. She was introduced to KADET by a staff member. 

Violet is requesting her first loan with KADET to buy clinic equipment. With the anticipated profit from her loan she will expand the clinic. Violet’s hopes and dreams are to open a maternity clinic.

loans.use: to buy clinic equipment

loans.name: Julia Nunu

texts.en:
Julia is a married woman who has three children between five and 10 years old. For the past seven years, she has been running a grocery store. Julia describes herself as honest and ambitious. Her business is located at Athiru-Gaiti in Maua town and her biggest challenge is the cost of buying goods.

Julia is requesting a 20,000 KES loan to add stock to her store. Her business goal is to run a hardware store within five years.

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Kevine

texts.en: Kevine is 28 years old. She is a single mother of two children and she has no other dependents. Kevine started with less than 1,000,000 shillings of capital, but now she has 3,000,000 shillings of working capital. Her main challenge is high transportation costs. Kevine is requesting a loan to buy charcoal to sell. Her personal goal is to educate her children and her business goal is to buy land for crop farming.

loans.use: to buy charcaol to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 44 year old business man. He is married to Elizabeth, who is a farmer. They are blessed with two children, aged eight and six years respectively. He has been in the welding business for the past ten years and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000, which he uses to support his family. Stephen is applying for his second loan term with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Stephen will use the loan to buy scrap metal for his business. With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife, so that they can help each other provide for their family's needs.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal for his business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica is a married woman. She has four children; the youngest is 5 and the eldest is 16. She describes herself as honest and courageous. Veronica operates a a retail store where she sells products for the home. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in the Kangetha Market in the town of Maua. Her biggest business challenge is the increasing cost of goods. She will use the requested Kes 20,000 loan to increase her stock of home products. Her business goal is to run another retail store within 5 years.

loans.use: to increase her stock of home products.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is applying for another loan to expand his poultry business, this time requesting 40,000 Kes for the purchase of chicken feed. In the future, he aspires to continue improving his business.

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Samson has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders, and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to purchase chicken feed for his business.

loans.name: Hotambi

texts.ru: Хотамби проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ей 32 года. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Ее муж бизнесмен а сын студент. Сама Хотамби занимается выращиванием овощей. Этим видом деятельности занимается десять лет. Кредит берет для посева картошки.
texts.en: Hotambi lives in the Qumsangur Region. She is 32 years old. She is married, with five children. Her husband is a businessman, and her son is a student. Hotambi grows vegetables. She has been doing this line of work for 10 years. She is taking out a loan in order to plant potatoes.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Rebecca Cioburu

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 52-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 9 to 25 years. She describes herself to be optimistic. 

She operates a grocery retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her business is located in the Kangetha market in Maua town. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the increased cost of vegetables and fruits. She will use this loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of  vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.ru: Рахмон разведен и сам воспитывает двоих детей. Он занимается купле - продажей скота и имеет хороший опыт. Он начинал свой бизнес с малого оборота денег. Он хочет, чтобы его дети выросли образованными и воспитанными людьми. Рахмон запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Рахмон надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас  за ваше милосердие и доброту.
texts.en: Rahmon is divorced and is raising two children on his own.  He is involved in buying and selling livestock and has good experience in this field.  He started his business with a small revolving capital.  Rahmon wants his children to grow up to be educated and well-mannered people.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of livestock in order to expand his business.  Rahmon relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your mercy and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Scholastica

texts.en:
Scholastica is 43 yeas old and an enterprising business lady. She is married to her husband Mackenzie, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children ages 16, 10 and 6 years. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past 11 years with the monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings (KES), which she uses to support her family.

Scholastica is applying for her third loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. She will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits to add to her stock. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: To buy green vegetables and fruits to add to her stock.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is planting rice crops on her one-hectare rice field. She is 56 years of age and married with six children. Margarita is a hardworking and responsible woman. She and her husband devote their time to performing some farming activities to minimize their expenses in hiring laborers. 

Margarita said that having a large number of family members means they need greater profits to sustain all their needs. In this regard, she would like to increase her rice production so that she could earn a bigger income. Margarita is asking for a loan of 30,000 PHP to be used in buying certified seeds, insecticides, herbicides and other farm supplies needed in the plant care of her crops. She believes that this loan will help her in satisfying the needs of her family and improving their lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, insecticides, herbicides and other farm supplies needed in the plant care of her crop

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a 33-year-old modest lady from Nyalenda estate, a populous low income estate within Kisumu city. She is married to Maurice and they have two children ages 5 and 2 years.

Mercy sells second hand clothes, a business she has been in for the last eight years. She joined KADET LTD when the need for micro-credit arose, and she is now taking her first loan, which she will use to buy more stock of clothing for sale.

She will use her profits to buy a piece of land and she dreams of owning her business premise in the near future.

loans.use: To buy stock of used clothing for resale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is applying for another loan to expand his existing business. He will use this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase sugar, wheat flour, eggs, and milk for his bakery. In the future, Stephen aspires to continue improving his business.

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Stephen has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase sugar, wheat flour, eggs, and milk for his bakery.

loans.name: Hope Group

texts.en:
Patrick is the facilitator of the Hope group. Patrick and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Patrick and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Patrick takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Patrick had an excellent maize yield harvesting six bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Patrick was only able to harvest two bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Patrick will invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Hope group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Patrick appears with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Monica Kinya

texts.en: Monica is a 37-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 2 and 8 years. She describes herself to be hopeful and ambitious. She operates a grocery retail business where she sells vegetables and fruits. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located at shopping center. She describes her biggest business challenge to be increased cost of vegetables and fruits. She will use this loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of assorted vegetables and fruits. Her business goal is to increase her turnover in monthly so as to increase the sales within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Immaculee

texts.en:
Immaculee is 35 years old and married to an evangelist. They have four children aged 5 to 12 years, three of whom are currently in school. 

She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 7 years. She would like a loan to buy more beans and sorghum to sell in her store. Immaculee would like to use any profits to buy a cow. She would one day like to own and run a larger store.

loans.use: To buy more food stuffs to sell.

loans.name: Valerie

texts.en:
Valerie is 42 years old with six children aged 3 to 17. She has also adopted one other child and all of them are in school. 

She sells foodstuffs in a store she has run for 4 years. She would like a loan to buy soap, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to sell in her store. She will use any profits to reinvest in the business. She would like to become a wholesaler in the future.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Cartas

texts.en:
Cartas is 40 years old with 5 children ages 7 to 17. All of her children are in school. Her husband works as a farmer. 

Cartas sells local soft drinks in a shop she has run for 7 years. She would like a loan to buy more sorgham, buckets, and straws to use for her business. Any profits will be used to reinvest in her business. She would love to one day own a sewing machine to generate more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum for making local drinks.

loans.name: Speciose

texts.en:
Speciose is 45 years old and has four children ages 13 to 26. Three of them are currently in school. She sells foodstuffs such as bananas and peanuts in a store she has run for 2 years. 

Speciose would like a loan to buy a milling machine for cassava and sorghum so she can turn them into flour to sell in her store. Any profits will be used to buy a cow to provide milk for her family. In the future, Speciose would like to have a large inventory to sell in her store.

loans.use: To buy beans and peanuts for resale.

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en: Dinah is a single mother of two children living in Hioma, Uganda. She has owned a textile business for five years. She started as a farmer and then saved money to start the textile business. She faces a challenge of the business being seasonal. Her personal goal is to build a house and her business goal is to expand her business to new markets. Dinah intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mawazo Muungano Group

texts.en:
Justus is the facilitator of the Mawazo Muungano group. Justus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Justus takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds. In the recent 2011 season, Justus had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Justus was only able to harvest six bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Justus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Justus will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Mawazo Muungano group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Sadeq

texts.en:
Sadeq, age 62, is a pensioner. He and his wife have raised four sons and seven daughters, and one of his sons is a worker with a decent salary. 

Sadeq wants to improve the conditions of his house. Preparations for the winter season must be made, such as replacing the windows and purchasing a new space heater.  He does not have the necessary funds for these necessities, so he is requesting a loan in the amount of $2,000 from FATEN. With the loan proceeds, he will prepare his house thoroughly for the winter season, allowing his family to experience better living conditions.

loans.use: to make essential preparations to the family home for the winter months, such as replacing the windows and purchasing a new space heater

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en: Vicent is 30 years old with two children and is a teacher by profession. He has been teaching for one year now and his personal goal is to build a permanent home, but the challenge has been raising funds for the construction. He intends to use the loan to buy building materials.

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Ya Kaday

texts.en:
This is 39 year-old Ya Kaday. She is married and has two children aged 23 and 3 years, both of whom are schoolchildren. She has one additional dependent, who lives with her to assist in the business. 

In 2005, Ya Kaday established her slippers business. She began her business because she  was brought up by her elder sister who did not think it was worthy for her to go school; instead, her sister let her assist in her business and since then she became a trader and business is a part of her. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 2,215,000 Sierra Leone leones (SLL) every month from this business.

Ya Kaday would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL.  She requires a loan in order to purchase Rubber Slippers (men), 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; Sandals 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; and Rubber Slippers (women) 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 333,000.

In the future, Ya Kaday plans to improve her business and her living condition.  It will help her as she is also planning to build a house. She wants to see her children through school.

The rainy season is her problem as the stall she is trading on is not well protected. Competition is high but she buys more goods and quality stock. She serves people in villages and the city town, about 15 people per day. She goes in for the latest designs and sells them at affordable prices.  She buys her goods in Freetown twice per month. Ya Kaday uses her profit by buying more goods to add to her existing ones. She wants to rent a shop that will protect her goods during the rainy season so she is working forward to that by accessing more loans. She is hardworking and honest. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase Rubber Slippers (men), 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; Sandals 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL; and Rubber Slippers (women) 1 dozen @ 1,000,000 SLL.

loans.name: Solomon

texts.en: Solomon is 45 years old and married, and the couple has two children. He deals in produce business and has been doing it for two years. Solomon has a challenge of price fluctuations and his business goal is to buy land for crop production. His personal goal is to educate his children. Solomon needs a loan to buy groundnuts and rice to sell.

loans.use: To buy groundnuts and rice to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a hardworking man age 33 and married with four children living in Hioma, Uganda. 

He has a transport business and he has been doing it for four years. He started as a motorcyclist and saved to buy the car he is currently using for transportation. He faces a challenge of poor roads. His personal goal is to educate his children. Julius intends to use the loan to buy tires for his vehicle.

loans.use: To buy tires.

loans.name: Nasieko

texts.en:
Nasieko is a modest business lady from the Nkararo area of Kilgoris County in Kenya. She is married to her husband Elijah and they have two children, both over 18 years although both are still under their care.

Nasieko sells cereals in Nkararo and has been running this business for the last ten years and thus has vast experience. She sells mainly maize cereals due to its big demand and ready markets and makes a monthly income of 11,400 Kenya shillings (KES). She is taking her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more maize cereals to boost her current stock.

She hopes to make enough profits, which she will use to invest in farming. Her dream is to expand her business and support her family through provision of basic needs and wants.

loans.use: To buy more maize cereals for sale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 10 to 30 years. She describes herself to be ambitious. 

She operates a retail store where she sells home products. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a busy shopping centre. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use this loan of 10,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to add stock of home products. Her business goal is to expand her business and increase the stock within 5 years.

loans.use: To add stock to the retail store.

loans.name: Ahamed

texts.en:
Ahamed is 57 years old and married with seven children. He deals in cattle buying and selling and has been in this business for 4 years. He is faced with a challenge of inflation. His business goal is to have many cows for sale and his personal goal is to have well-educated children.

Ahmed needs a loan to buy cattle for resale.

loans.use: To buy cows for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old and supports a family of five people. She is married and blessed with five children ages 25,23,18,16, and 13 years. Mary owns a tailoring shop in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for a period of six years, earning a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

She has applied for a loan of 40,000 KES from KADET LTD, this being her fourth loan after she successfully repaid the previous loans. She wishes to use this amount to purchase stock for her business.  

The profits will be used to educate her children and improve the living standards of the family as a whole. Her dream is to own a tailoring school and also prosper in business.

loans.use: To purchase stock for the business.

loans.name: Wesakulila Group

texts.en:
Benson is the facilitator of the Wesakulila group. Benson and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Benson and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Benson takes care of six children at home. He joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for his family and to have additional maize profits to send his children to school. In the recent 2011 season, Benson had a very good maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Benson was only able to harvest five bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from his maize sales, Benson will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Wesakulila group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph, Benson is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Anatoli

texts.en:
Anatoli is 26 years old and married with three children. He deals in spare parts for motorcycles and has been in this business for two and a half years. He is faced with a challenge of inflation, which affects his purchasing power and yet he has a high demand for his goods. His business goal is to operate a large-scale spare parts business and his personal goal is to educate his children.

Anatoli wants a loan to purchase spare parts for motorcycles to meet the high demand.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycles to sell.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимджон начинал свою деятельность с купли- продажи скота и их откармливания. Более 5 лет он занимается этим бизнесом и успешен в своем деле. Он покупает скот на рынке кишлака, привозит домой и откармливают их в течение 15-20 дней. После откармливания  продает на местном  рынке за хорошую цену, от  которой получает прибыль. Олимджон запрашивает займ для покупки мелко рогатого скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Олимджон надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарит вас за ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Olimjon started his business with buying and selling livestock and fattening it up.  He has been involved in this business for over five years and is successful at it.  He buys livestock at the village market, delivers it home and fattens it up for 15-20 days.  After fattening it up, Olimjon sells livestock at the local market at a good price, from which he gets a profit.  He is requesting this loan for the purchase of small livestock in order to expand his business.  Olimjon relies on your help and thanks you in advance for your mercy.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is applying for another loan to expand his existing business. He will use this loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more spare parts and accessories for his business. In the future, Patrick aspires to continue expanding his business.

Since taking his last Kiva loan, Patrick has greatly improved his family’s standard of living. He hopes to continue accessing the financial services offered by Yehu and Kiva lenders and thanks you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase equipment and cables for his electrical business.

loans.name: Noah

texts.en: Noah, a 44-year-old married father of eight, has been operating a butcher business for eight years. His main challenge is uncertain weather conditions which affect sales, thus leading to some losses. His business goal is to have a ranch, and his personal goal is to educate all of his children. Noah intends to use this loan to buy animals to sell ahead of the festive season.

loans.use: to buy goats and cows to sell.

loans.name: Mabrouk

texts.en: Mabrouk, a 25-year-old taxi driver with a low income, also raises sheep to increase his earnings in order to improve his living conditions. Mabrouk is now requesting a loan from FATEN to purchase more fodder for his sheep.

loans.use: to purchase fodder for the sheep he is raising.

loans.name: Herbert

texts.en:
Herbert is a 52-year-old married man living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He works driving a taxi. Herbert started his business with a motorcycle and after accumulating enough savings, he bought a taxi. His business challenges are high fuel and transportation costs and seasonal weather. 

Herbert is requesting a loan to buy a plot of land. His personal goals are to educate his children and save for their weddings.

loans.use: to buy a plot of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, beans, and cooking oil

loans.name: Nabayi Shg B Group

texts.en:
Titus is the facilitator of the Nabayi SHG B group. Titus and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Titus takes care of four children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Titus had a good maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Titus was only able to harvest five bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Titus and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Titus will educate his children.

In 2012, the members of Nabayi SHG B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

Titus and members of his group appear with their field officer who is on the left side of the photograph.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Diloromkhon

texts.ru: Дилоромхон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ей 57 лет. Она замужем. У нее один ребенок. Она у себя дома открыла пекарню, где печет и продает лепешки. В этой области она семь лет. Кредит берет для приобретения несколько мешков муки и угля.
texts.en: Diloromkhon lives in the city of Khujand.  She is 57 years old, married and has one child.  She opened a bakery at her home, where she bakes and sells flatbread.  Diloromkhon has been in this business for seven years.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of several bags of flour and coal.

loans.use: to purchase several bags of flour and coal

loans.name: Lamrana

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Lamrana. She is widow with two children ages 12 and 14 who both attend school. Lamrana also supports her two nieces who live with her since she is in the city, where there are better schools. In 2000, Lamrana established a business selling cereals and groundnuts. She began her business because her late father believed that girls were not meant for school, so she was not able to attend school. Since her mother was a businesswoman, Lamrana decided to join her, and she has had her business since she was a teenager. She works 10-hour days, seven days a week, and earns about 2,866,000 SLL each month. She has an outdoor stall and the rainy season is her major challenge as she has enough goods to meet her customer’s needs. Lamrana serves housewives and people around the city center, serving over 10 people each day with good prices. She employs a cousin to help her and she gets her supplies wholesale from neighboring villages. 

Lamrana is requesting a 4,500,000 SLL loan to purchase groundnuts, benni seeds, and soya beans. She has repaid two previous loans. She feels that her loans are a great help because she cannot do business without money. Lamrana is excited about the status of her business and hopes that her loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 430,000 SLL.  In the future, she plans to build a house.  If Lamrana is given chance to access more loans, she wants expand to a much better business location.  Lamrana is hardworking and honest and she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of groundnuts, two bags of benni seeds, and two-and-a-half bags of soya beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereal to sell

loans.name: Bidii Shg A Group

texts.en:
Damaris is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG A group. Damaris and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Damaris and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

Damaris takes care of three children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough to secure food for her family and to have additional maize profits to send her children to school. With income from her maize sales, Damaris will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing and business as savings for future use.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG A group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Damaris with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Munojot

texts.ru: Муноджот умная и добросовестная девушка. Она очень трудолюбивая, и она занимается купле- продажей скота. Она является владельцем данного бизнеса, и любит свой бизнес. Муноджот хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить желаемой прибыли для того чтобы помогать своим родителям и улучшить условия семьи. Она запрашивает займ в размере 12000 Сомони для покупки скота и ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Munojot is a smart and conscientious young woman.  She is a very hardworking person and is involved in buying and selling livestock.  She is the owner of this business, which she loves.  Munojot wants to expand her business and make a desired profit, so that she could help her parents and improve her family's conditions.  She is requesting a loan in the sum of 12000 Somoni to purchase livestock and repair a car.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and repair a car

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year-old lady from Nyalenda Estate, a low income estate in Kisumu City, western Kenya. She is married to Henry, a businessman, and they have four children between seven and 15 years old. For the past eight years, Elizabeth has operated a beauty salon in Nyalenda. 

Elizabeth joined KADET LTD and is requesting a loan to buy additional salon equipment such as blow-driers and hair dryers. She intends to use the anticipated profits from her loan to buy land where she can build a house as this has been her hope and dream.

loans.use: to buy hair dryers

loans.name: Humu

texts.en:
This is 33-year-old Humu.  She is married to a businessman, and has four children aged 13, 9, 7 and 2 years. Three are in school.
 
In 2007, Humu established her vegetable oil, toys, and jeans business. She began her business because she had lived with her stepmother, who did not allow her to attend school, but instead forced the family to sell for her.  Humu did not finish her primary education and joined her stepmother in doing business.  It made her independent. That’s why she likes doing business. 
 
Humu works 7 days a week and 11 hours a day and earns about Le 2,168,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Humu requires a loan in order to purchase 25 containers of vegetable oil @ Le 120,000. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 326,000. 

In the future, Humu plans to open a provision shop and a savings account.   She wants another shop to display her goods, as she needs a larger space to operate her business.  She wants her children to be important people in society. That’s why she needs additional capital to help her boost her business. 
 
A rise in transport costs and the rainy season are her major challenges.  The competition is low, as two people are dealing with the same product but Humu has a larger stock.  She is hardworking and honest.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase 25 containers of vegetable oil @ Le120,000.

loans.name: Nita

texts.en:
Nita is 35 years-old. She is married and has one child, age 6.  In 2001, she established  her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 5 hours a day, she supports her family.  Nita has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and will use her most recent loan to buy seeds and fertilizers.  In the future, Nita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.   


Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural.  Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land.  Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet.  With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market.  Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sheep for her family's business.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is a thirty three year old modest lady from Kisumu city, a city along the shores of Lake Victoria, Kenya. She is married to Jared and they have three children between three and seven years of age.

Evaline operates a second hand clothes business in Kisumu town and has been doing this for the last four years. She makes a monthly income of Kes 5,000. She is requesting a first loan of Kes 20,000 which she will use to buy more used clothing for sale. 

Evaline plans to save her profits so that she can buy a plot and build a residential house for her family.

loans.use: To buy used clothing for sale.

loans.name: Japhet

texts.en: Japhet is 27 years old and is married with three children ages 3 to 5 years. His wife is a farmer. He owns a general store which he has been running for 1.5 years. Japhet would like a loan to buy more salt, cooking oil, sugar, and soap to sell in his store. Any profits from the business will be used to renovate his house. He hopes to expand his shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy more salt, cooking oil and sugar

loans.name: Yvonne B.

texts.en: Yvonne lives in West Point. She is 27 years old, single and has a nine year old child who is in school. For five years, Yvonne has been involved in the sale of fashion clothes and bags.  She has many customers since her business is in a very good location in the market. Yvonne is requesting a loan to buy fashionable clothes and bags (blouses, jeans trousers and hand bags) and many other items for her business. She plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy fashion clothes and hand bags for her business

loans.name: Simana Group

texts.en:
Magdaline is the facilitator of the Simana group. Magdaline and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Magdaline takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Magdaline had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Magdaline was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Magdaline and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Magdaline will educate her children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Simana group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 59 years old and married.  She is blessed with five children ages 26, 22,18,13 and eight years.  She owns a poultry farm in Kapsaret and has been in the business for a period of six years earning a monthly income of KES. 12,000. She raises the local breed of poultry.

Ruth is requesting her first loan from KADET LTD  and wants to use this amount to purchase more poultry and feed. The anticipated profit will be used to improve the number of poultry she rears and to educate her children. Ruth hopes to improve her poultry farm and rear broilers as well as layers.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en: Melanie is 64 years old with three children, aged 25 to 42. She is a widow. She sells foodstuffs in a store that she has run for one year. Melanie would like a loan to buy sorghum and beans to sell in her store. Her business has helped her very much in providing for her family. She hopes to use any profits to renovate her house. Someday, she would like to have a large inventory for her store.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Bidii Shg B Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is the facilitator of the Bidii SHG B group. Beatrice and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Beatrice and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Beatrice had an excellent maize yield harvesting 24 bags on one acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Beatrice was only able to harvest eight bags of maize on one acre of land.

With income from her maize sales, Beatrice will invest in livestock rearing and educate her children.

In 2012, the members of Bidii SHG B group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

The photograph shows Beatrice with her group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Radhika

texts.en:
Radhika, a 48-year-old married mother of two children aged 26 and 24, established her tailoring business in 2000. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family. Having already received and repaid five loans from Patan BPW to buy raw materials for her work, Radhika is requesting a new loan for the same purpose. She plans to continue working to uplift the economic condition of her family, and she thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, clothing is made to order. Tailor stalls line the streets where store owners sell material and work their sewing machines. These skilled tailors make school uniforms for children as well as the the traditional women's kurta surwal and men's daura surwal. With a Kiva loan, BPW borrowers are able to purchase additional cloth material or sewing machines that will increase production and profitability.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 38-year-old Mohamed. He is engaged to a business woman and has 1 child, age 10 years. 

In 1994, Mohamed established his hair dressing salon, hair products and attachments business. He began his business because he did not go to school. Since his elder brother owns a beauty salon, that's where Mohamed joined. He was trained into the business. He makes good profit out of it and it is what he knows best. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about 1,084,000 SLL every month from this business. He serves ladies and women of the city centre and neighboring villages. Mohamed is good at his business. He designs the latest hair styles, attachments and other products to fit their earnings. He has two suppliers located in Freetown. He normally buys his hair products and attachments three times per month using public transportation.  

He would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Mohamed has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase attachments – Hair Weavon - 5 dozen @ 360,000 SLL and Expression Hair - 1 dozen @ 1,200,000 SLL. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 163,000 SLL. 

In the future, Mohamed plans to build a house with a shop. By taking this loan, it will help him increase his capital and get more profits. He is so excited with his type business as a male. He wants to educate his son so he becomes a good citizen in the future. The rainy season is his challenge as his business usually slows down. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase attachments – Hair Weavon - 5 dozen @ 360,000 SLL and Expression Hair - 1 dozen @ 1,200,000 SLL

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah used his first loan amount to buy fertilizer as well as plough his land during the previous planting season. He was able to plant and make a good harvest which was very profitable. He paid the loan amount well and in good time. This will be his second loan and he plans to use the loan amount to buy dairy meal and medicine for his livestock.

Besides farming as his primary activity, Jonah is also a veterinary doctor and offers veterinary services to farmers around and out of Olkalau area. In the future, Jonah hopes to start his own offices and clinic to offer veterinary services to farmers in the region.

loans.use: to buy dairy meal and livestock medicine

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is 42 years old. She is married and has 3 children, ages 21, 19 and 15. 

In 1999, Jayanti established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Jayanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Romelo

texts.en:
Romelo works hard to provide a living.  He is 45 years old, married and has been blessed with four children.  One of his children is settled into marriage and is living separately, while two other children have stopped their studies for the meantime, due to a lack of financial funds.  The other child is studying.  Romelo said that he couldn't afford to send them all to school.

Romelo plans to earn a greater income and save some money for the bright future of his children.  According to him, the generated income goes immediately to his obligation to traders who have high interest rates. For now, he looks for ways to fulfil his dreams.  The only thing he can do is to borrow additional capital from lenders who have low interest rates, so that he could purchase some farm inputs to improve his rice fields.  For this reason, he is asking for a loan worth PHP 30,000.  This amount has a great impact because he will no longer borrow his farm inputs from traders who have high interest rates.  He would be thankful if the loan amount he requested be granted.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs for his agriculture business.

loans.name: Ruwa Kumari

texts.en: Ruwa is a resident of Thikedewal. She and her husband, Mr. Lal Bahadur, are engaged in selling green vegetables. They buy the vegetables from Kalimati market and sell them daily in the local market in the morning and evening.
